She and her husband have been working in a rubber plantation for over two years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Mao wants to run an additional business. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of USD 1300 to pay for potato cultivation. This money will help her to acquire the security to start an agricultural business. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay for potato cultivation

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en:
As a mother of two children, Neng earns a living by cultivating her rice paddy and growing vegetables. She makes around three US dollars a day. After accounting for expenses, she can only save around one US dollar. She has used her savings to renovate her house and expand her business. 

Neng received her first loan from VisionFund in 2011. After completely repaying her debt, she requested another loan to prepare land for growing rice and vegetables. Now she leads a two-member loan group, both of whom are female. With the second loan, Neng hopes to save enough money to keep her boy and girl in school until they finish high school.

loans.use: To grow rice and vegetables

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is a forty-three-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese. His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to expand his business to new markets.

Cleophas wants the money to buy sugar, rice and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and  soap to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme de 50ans. Elle est mariée à un retraité et a 03 enfants dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 26ans et le dernier 18ans. Elle est revendeuse de pur water (eau minérale mise en sachet) depuis 1997. Une personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité. Elle est à son premier crédit et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus d’eau minérale. Elle veut récréer une autre activité (ouverture d’une boutique d’alimentation générale) et assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi is a 50 year old woman.  Her husband is retired and she has three children, two of whom are in school.  The eldest of her children is 26 years old, the youngest 18.  She has been a retailer of Pur Water (mineral water stored in a bag) since 1997.  She has one person helping her with her business operations.

This will be her first loan, which she plans to use to purchase more mineral water.  She would like to start another business (open a general food shop) and ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of pure water.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reyna es una mujer apasionada a su trabajo ya que desde hace 14 años se dedica a la venta de comida ambulante, agradece a Dios siendo este su principal apoyo y luego a la micro-fianciera. Asegura que aun siendo madre soltera manifiesta ser el pilar para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos. Por ahora su inquietud es seguirle reinvirtiendo a su negocio,con el fin de ofrecerle a su clientela un menu mas variado y aumentar sus ganancias, logrando asi un mayor grado de fidelidad por parte de sus clientes y una estabildad en el mercado al que ella se dirige.Para ello necesitara realizar las siguientes compras de granos basicos tales como: arroz, frijol, aceite, azucar, harina, maiz, entre otros productos. A futuro espera tener los recursos economicos necesarios para llegar a construir su vivienda e instalar tuberias en servicios higienicos, logrando con esto  mejores condiciones en pro de su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna is a woman passionate about her work, as she has been selling food as a street vendor for 14 years. She is grateful to God, and also to the microfinance institution, as this is her main livelihood.  She assures us that even as a single mother, she is the mainstay for raising her three children.  

At the moment, her concern is to keep reinvesting in her business, with the aim of offering her customers a more varied menu and increasing her earnings. In this way she will achieve a greater degree of customer loyalty, and stability in the market to which she is directing her efforts. 

For this reason, she will need to undertake the purchase of basic staples such as rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, flour, corn, and other products. 

In the future, she hopes to have the financial resources to manage to build her home and install indoor plumbing; this way achieving better conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy basic staples for her business.

loans.name: Aminatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes. La représentante du nom d'Aminatou est âgée de 50 ans. Aminatou est mariée et a trois enfants. Elle est a un niveau d'instruction secondaire. Pour supporter les charges quotidiennes, elle mène comme activité la vente de pagnes, parfums, jus de fruits dans une boutique depuis cinq ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de satisfaire sa clientèle, Aminatou sollicite, ensemble avec sa coéquipière un premier crédit auprès de Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: This group is made up of two people.  The group representative, named Aminatou, is 50 years old.  She is married with three children and has a secondary level education.  To pay her daily expenses, she has been selling cloth, perfume, and fruit juices in a shop for the last five years.  She buys her merchandise in a market in Benin.  In order to better serve her customers, Aminatou and the other member of her team are requesting their first credit through Finadev.  Aminatou is shown at left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 20 packages of fruit juice and 10 pieces of cloth

loans.name: Moisés De Jesús

texts.es: Moisés de Jesús habita junto con su esposa e hijos en casa de su propiedad. Él se dedica al cultivo y comercio de los principales granos básicos como: maíz y frijoles. Año con año realiza la misma actividad dado que esta es la principal fuente de ingresos que posee. Es muy conocido en la zona como un hombre emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. Su familia es lo más importante y es la que lo impulsa a seguir trabajando duramente para llevar el pan de cada día. Su sueño es dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida por lo que ha decidido hacer este préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertir en los principales insumos agrícolas como: insecticidas, abonos, semillas, etc. Para continuar cosechando los granos básicos para su hogar y para el comercio de los mismos. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que de esta manera logrará su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Moisés de Jesús lives together with his wife and children in a house that he owns. He works growing and selling the leading basic crops such as corn and beans. Year for year, he carries out the same activity, since it is his main source of income. He is very well-known in the area as an enterprising, responsible and hard-working man. His family is the most important thing to him, and they are what drives him to keep working hard to provide their daily bread. His dream is to give his family a better quality of life, and for that reason he has decided to take out this loan with INTEGRAL to invest in the main agricultural supplies such as insecticides, fertilizers, seeds, etc., so he can continue harvesting the basic crops for his household and to sell. He says that he trusts in God Almighty that in this way he will achieve his dream of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Mario Alfonso

texts.es:
Mario, se dedica a la venta de marisco y es propietario de un equipo de pesca, él vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 15 años, lo heredo de sus padres.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de pescado fresco y preparación del motor de la lancha, este préstamo le ayudara a mantener el equipo de pesca en buenas condiciones, y tambien aumentar los productos para la venta.
La aspiración de Mario es tener mejores oportunidades de crecimiento, comprando a futuro un nuevo equipo de pesca.
texts.en:
Mario works selling seafood, and he is also the owner of a fishing boat with equipment. He lives with his wife and two children, aged 11 and 8. He has had this business for 15 years, and he inherited it from his parents. 

Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy fresh fish and to repair the motor of his boat. This loan will help him maintain his fishing setup in good continue, and also to increase his offering of products for sale. 

Mario's aspiration is to have better opportunities for growth and to buy a new fishing setup in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and repair the motor of his boat.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov is a villager of Tbaung Khmum district. She is married and has four children, two of whom are still studying. Pov supports the family by farming and spice planting. She can save around one US dollar a day after netting off the income and expense. This is her second loan with VisionFund. 

Pov is now the leader of a loan group with two female members. She requested the loan to cultivate her rice field and grow spices with the leftover money. Pov hopes the loan will help to increase her crop yield so as to increase income for her family so that she can renovate her house and keep all her children in school until they finish high school.

loans.use: To cultivate her rice paddy and grow spices

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Teng

texts.en:
Teng, 45, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been growing rubber for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 25 per day. In order to improve her business, Teng is requesting a loan of USD 625 to purchase more rubber plants to cultivate. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to support the family.

 In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house next year.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber plants to cultivate

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 49 year-old widower with two children. He has been a livestock farmer for the past six years.

This is Philip's first loan from Kiva field partner Kadet Ltd.  He was introduced to Kadet by another borrower.  He plans to use the loan funds to build a zero-grazing unit on his farm.

His hopes and dreams are to become a prominent farmer within his locality.

loans.use: to build a zero-grazing unit for livestock

loans.name: Jonathan Alexander

texts.es:
Jonathan, vive con su esposa, en casa familiar, no tienen hijos, él se dedica a la venta de mariscos, compra los productos en el malecón, y los vende en otro departamento donde es poca la presencia de mariscos.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mariscos frescos como pescado, camarones, langostas, conchas, con esto podrá mantener su calidad en el producto y atender la demanda de los clientes.
La aspiración de Jonathan es comprarse un vehículo, en el cual pueda transportarse a distintas zonas, para ofrecer los mariscos.
texts.en:
Jonathan lives with his wife in the family home. They have no children. He sells seafood. He buys products at the harbor and sells them in another part of the country where there is little seafood.

He is applying for a loan to buy fresh seafood such as fish, shrimp, lobster, and clams. This way he will be able to maintain his product quality and meet customer demand. 

Jonathan's ambition is to buy a vehicle in which he can transport himself to various areas to sell seafood.

loans.use: To buy fish, shrimp, lobster, and clams.

loans.name: El Buen Amigo Group

texts.es: Doña Alicia es miembro del Grupo Solidario El Buen Amigo, tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y madre de 8 hijos, ella reside en la comunidad de San Nicolás. Su esposo trabaja en la agricultura. Doña Alicia se dedica al horneado de pan y a la elaboración de tableta, trabaja todos los días y lo hace sola ya que no tiene quien le ayude, los clientes le encargan los pedidos de pan y tableta, y en ocasiones cuando no lo puede vender todo sale a vender su producto. El único inconveniente es que debido al trabajo y por el calor del horno ha tenido problemas de salud y esto le ha ocasionado algunos gastos. El préstamo que doña Rosaura solicita es para surtir su negocio en la compra de productos como ser: harina, huevos, soda, sal, leche, azúcar, entre otros. Con la ayuda de este préstamo el nivel de vida su familia cambiaria, ya que podrá elaborar mayor cantidad de pan y tableta para ofrecerle mas a sus clientes. Su sueño es ver profesionales a sus hijos y poder ahorrar para hacerle mejoras a su casa. Doña Alicia ha sido cliente de FAMA desde hace veinte años y ha podido cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Alicia is a member of the communal bank "El Buen Amigo" ["The Good Friend"]. She is 62 years old, married, and the mother of 8 children. She lives in the community of San Nicolás. Her husband works in agriculture. Alicia works baking bread and making tableta [coconut candy]. She works every day, and she does it by herself since she does not have anyone to help her. Her customers place orders for bread and tableta, and on occasion when she can't sell everything, she goes out to sell her products. The only inconvenience is that due to the work and the heat of the oven, she has had some health problems, and this has led to some costs. The loan that she is requesting is to stock her business by purchasing products such as flour, eggs, baking soda, salt, milk, and sugar, among others. With the help of this loan, her family's standard of living will change, since she will be able to prepare a greater quantity of bread and tableta to offer more to her customers. Her dream is to see her children become professionals and be able to save up to make improvements to her house. Alicia has been a client of FAMA for twenty years, and she has been able to fulfill her payment schedules punctually.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, sugar, eggs and other ingredients.

loans.name: Subhi

texts.en:
Subhi is a 39-year-old married man who has three sons and one daughter.

For the past three years, he has been selling used home appliances such as stoves and washing machines.  It has been a profitable project for him. but he needs more capital to help cover costs and grow his business.  In the photograph that accompanies this profile, Subhi in shown in his store.

Subhi plans to use this $1,000 loan from Kiva field partner FATEN to buy used home appliances in bulk. He hopes this will allow him to offer his customers a wider variety of appliances, lead to increased sales, and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy used home appliances in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Chege

texts.en:
Chege is 52 years old.  He is married to Catherine and they have four children.  He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 12 years.

This is his third loan with KADET ltd.  He paid his previous loans well and in good time.  He will use the funds from this loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor during planting.

He hopes to be a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor during planting.

loans.name: Bahriddin

texts.ru: Бахриддин трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Более 15 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и он знаком с этим бизнесом с детства. После развала СССР он арендовал земельный участок, со временем арендовал участок земли в дехканском хозяйстве. От полученной прибыли он хочет женить своего сына. Бахриддин запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и горюче-смазочных материалов.
texts.en: Bahriddin is a hardworking and conscientious person.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 15 years and has been familiar with this business since childhood.  After the breakup of the USSR, he leased a land plot and with time leased land at a dekhan farm.  He wants to use his profits to marry off his son.  Bahriddin is requesting this loan to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.ru: Лутфулло трудолюбивый и добрый семьянин, который на воспитании имеет троих детей. Лутфулло раньше работал в России строителем. Он хороший строитель. Но вернувшись на Родину, на свой накопленный капитал взял землю в аренду. Многолетний опыт в земледелии помог ему получить хорошую прибыль. Он хочет в дальнейшем расширить свой бизнес и расширить площадь земли для посева. Лутфулло запрашивает займ для покупки семян, горюче-смазочных материалов и оплаты рабочей силы.
texts.en: Lutfullo is a hardworking and kind family man, who has three children.  Lutfullo previously worked in Russia as a construction worker.  He is a good construction worker.  After returning to his homeland, he used his saved capital to lease land.  His extensive experience in farming helped him to make a good profit.  He wants to continue expanding his business and the land area used for sowing.  Lutfullo is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fuel and lubricants, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel and lubricants, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en:
Voeurn is 34 years old.  He is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  He has been selling fruits and vegetables for over seven years, earning approximately $6 per day.  His wife runs a food store and earns about $5 per day.  

Due to insufficient funds, Voeurn is requesting a loan of $1,300 to raise capital in his business in order to purchase more fruit for resale.  By doing so, he would be able to increase his profits and support the family.  In the future, he would like to use the profits to expand his business and to help his children earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to raise capital in his business and purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is a 39-years-old mother of five children, all of whom are working as construction workers in Thailand. To support the family, she has been farming, growing vegetables and works as a construction worker to make additional income. She earns around three US dollar per day. 

Mom is a new client to VisionFund. She requested the loan to buy a water pump. The water pump will help her by not have to carry water from the river to water her crops and farm. She hopes to grow her rice and vegetables in good quantity and sell at good prices so that she can have more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.ru: Саидмурод женат и ответственный отец четверых детей.  Много лет уже Саидмурод занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур, имеет в этом большой богатый опыт. В прошлом году, большие затраты на выращивание сельхозпродукции вынуждало его продавать скот  для выращивания сельхозкультур, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль от кукурузы и кунжут и вернут проданный скот. Теперь в этом году с целью сохранения поголовье скота он хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян и горюче-смазочных материалов. А также остальную сумму он хочет использовать для оплаты услуги техники и рабочей силы.
texts.en: Saidmurod is married and a responsible father of four children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for many years and has a very rich experience in this field.  Last year, large expenses on growing agricultural crops forced him to sell livestock in order to continue growing crops. He wants to make a good profit from corn and sesame seeds and return the sold livestock.  Now, this year, Saidmurod wants to obtain a loan to buy seeds, fuel and lubricants in order to save the livestock headcount.  He also wants to use some of the money to pay for machinery services and labor.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Eum

texts.en:
Eum is 64 years old.  She is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She is a homemaker who receives support from the children.  All of her children are employed.  They are garment workers and waiters.  Together, they earn approximately $12 per day.  

In order to improve her family’s economy, Eum is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a tuk tuk (a motorcycle pulling a passenger trailer or a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi) for her son to run a public transportation service. This purchase would enable her son to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk for her son to run a public transportation service

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old, married to Ann and they have two children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is his first loan with kadet ltd of kes 50,000. He was introduced by a Kadet client. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting.

His hopes and dreams are to be a leading mixed farmer in his area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: No

texts.en:
No, 33, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been running a business of purchasing poultry to resale for over two years, earning approximately USD 20 per day. Her husband runs a public transportation service (motor taxi). Additionally, he is involved in breeding pigs at home to generate extra income to financially support the family. Approximately, he earns USD 5 per day. 

No wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, No is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This loan would enable her provide a comfortable living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et 2 enfants, les femmes du groupe Danaya habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Elles  se sont spécialisées dans la teinture et vente des habits teintés. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 12ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Gnedjougou (première femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est un membre qui fat essentiellement la prestation de service. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 cartons de teintures de colories différentes, 50 kilos de soude caustique et 2 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe.   Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  prestations, à domicile, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Gnedjougou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  185.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
Most of them married in traditional families and with an average age of 27 and two children each, the women in the Danaya group all live in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).  They know each other through family, marriage, and neighborhood connections.  They specialize in dyeing and selling dyed clothing.  With the goal of increasing their business capital, the women are members of Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their 12th collective loan cycle.  

Mrs. Gnedjougou (first on the left in the photo) is a member who provides services.  She plans to use her loan to buy ten cartons of different colored dyes, 50 kilos of caustic soda, and two cartloads of firewood.  She buys from local wholesalers and runs her business out of her home for a customer base made up of men and women.  Mrs. Gnedjougou expects to make an average monthly profit of 185,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and buy spices for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for dye.

loans.name: Jiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 2 enfants, les six femmes du groupe Jiguiseme habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités professionnelles.  Elles  se sont spécialisées dans la teinture et vente des habits teintés. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 12ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Safiatou (première femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est un membre qui fat essentiellement la prestation de service. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50 cartons de teintures de colories différentes, 20 kilos de soude caustique et 2 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe.   Elle s’approvisionne sur place  à Sikasso, auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  prestations, à domicile, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Safiatou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  180.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
Most of them married in traditional families and with an average age of 26 and two children each, the six women in the Jiguiseme group all live in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). They know each other through family, neighborhood, and business connections. They specialize in dyeing and selling dyed clothing. With the goal of increasing their business capital, the women are members of Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their 12th collective loan cycle.

Mrs. Safiatou (on the right in the photo) is a member who provides services. She plans to use her loan to buy 50 cartons of different colored dyes, 20 kilos of caustic soda, and two cartloads of firewood. She buys from local wholesalers in Sikasso and runs her business out of her home for a customer base made up of men and women. With the loan, Mrs. Safiatou expects to make an average monthly profit of 180,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and buy spices for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for dye.

loans.name: Nelson Wilfredo

texts.es: Nelson Wilfredo de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una venta y reparación de celulares en el mercado municipal de la zona; últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles, el negocio de los celulares es muy demandado además ahora que vamos a entrar de vacaciones quiere tener producto novedoso, para que la gente compre o repare sus teléfonos; Nelson es un hombre entregado a su labor, muy honrado y dispuesto a superarse, piensa que el  punto de partida para una nueva vida llega cuando te das cuenta de que puedes aprender cualquier cosa, que necesitas para lograr las metas que te has fijado; él se dio cuenta es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar celulares, repuestos, accesorios etc. Nelson Wilfredo tiene la fe puesta en Dios que de esta forma mejorara la situación económica de su hogar.
texts.en:
Nelson Wilfredo is 39, and lives with his life companion and their children in their own house. He has a business selling and repairing cell phones in the local municipal market. Lately he has gotten a lot of customers, as everything he sells is very good quality, and he sells it at affordable prices. The cell phone business has very good demand, and as the vacation season is now starting, he wants to have new product, so that people will buy or repair their telephones. 

Nelson is a man dedicated to his work; very honest, and ready to improve himself.  He believes that the point of departure for a new life is when you realize you can learn anything you need, to achieve the goals that you have set your mind to. He realized this, and that is why he is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy cell phones, parts, accessories, etc. 

Nelson Wilfredo has put his faith in God that in this way he will improve his household's financial situation.

loans.use: To buy cell phones, parts, and accessories.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cristina, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, ella administra una tienda y chalet, tiene un año en el negocio, surgió por iniciativa propia y su esposo le colabora en la atención a los clientes.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, como embutidos, galletas, boquitas, dulces, gaseosas, jugos, para mantener surtido el negocio y mayor variedad para los clientes.
La aspiración de Cristina es desarrollarse con el negocio, instalar otro local, para aumentar la rentabilidad para el beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina lives with her husband and two children who are 12 and 8 years old. She manages a store and cottage and has had the business for one year. She started it through her own initiative and her husband helps her to wait on customers.

She is applying for a loan to purchase merchandise for her business, such as sausages, cookies, snacks, sweets, soft drinks and juices in order to keep it well stocked and offer greater variety to her customers.

Cristina’s aspiration is to develop along with her business and to establish another store in order to increase profits, which will benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy sausages, cookies, snacks, sweets, soft drinks and juice.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 60-years-old single mother of five children. She is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is her first loan with Kadet ltd. She was introduced by a Kadet client. She will use the loan to purchase more chicks and poultry feed.

Her hopes and dreams to be a renowned farmer in her locality.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Sareith

texts.en:
Sareith, 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in rubber plantation for over two years, earning approximately USD 11 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Sareith is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to commute. 

This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to earn extra income to support the family. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for the family and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 65-year-old widow, and she has been selling clothes for the last ten years. 

This is Edith's first loan with KADET LTD, and she was introduced to KADET by an existing client. She plans to use the loan to buy more clothes for sale.

In the future, Edith hopes to invest more in her business and use the proceeds for poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay, 57, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for over 20 years. She has extensive experience and is successful in her career. Lay is involved in growing rice and vegetables to sell. She earns approximately 5 USD per day. Two of her children are employed. One is a garment worker and the other a construction worker. They earn about 8 USD per day. 

Lay wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Lay requests a loan of 700 USD to purchase construction materials. This loan would enable her to provide convenient living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business in animal husbandry to generate more income and stabilize the family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
Gabino es un padre de 43 de años, el mismo que se ha dedicado a brindar el servicio de transporte público en su moto taxi propia, la misma que pudo comprar ahorrando un poco de dinero y pagando poco a poco las cuotas que le hacían falta.  Gabino siempre trata de pasar tiempo de calidad con su hijo de 19 años, al cual cuida y mantiene solo debido a que su esposa ya no vive con ellos por algunos problemas familiares.

Gabino se ha dedicado a esta actividad cerca de 8 años, en las que ha aprendido y disfruta mucho de su trabajo, él siempre está pendiente de levantarse muy temprano para transportar a las personas que necesitan acudir a sus centros educativos o de trabajo, lo que le permite ganar el dinero que necesita para llevar los alimentos a su casa.

Actualmente el necesita apoyo económico con el fin de de poder comprar llantas, herramientas y hacerle un mantenimiento general a su moto taxi debido a que tiene algunas dificultades técnicas, Gabino es consciente de que este es su único medio de ingreso y es por eso que quiere que se encuentre en buen estado para no tener la carencia de alimentos en el transcurso de estos meses. Gabino quiere salir adelante, mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y así en un futuro no muy lejano poder ponerlo a estudiar una carrera profesional y desde luego comprarse una nueva moto taxi, ya que la suya ya es muy vieja y se está deteriorando.
texts.en:
Gabino is a 43 year old father.   He has devoted himself to providing public transportation in his own “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle).  He was able to buy the taxi by saving a little money and, little by little, making the payments he needed to make.  

Gabino always tries to spend quality time with his 19 year old son.  He takes care of and supports his son by himself.  This is due to the fact that his wife no longer lives with them because of some family problems.

Gabino has been doing this business activity for close to eight years.  During these years he has learned, and he enjoys his work a lot.  He always gets up very early in order to transport the people who need to go to their educational centers or to work.  This allows him to earn the money he needs to bring food home.

He currently needs financial support to be able to buy tires, to buy tools, and to perform general maintenance on his moto taxi.  It has some technical difficulties.  Gabino is aware that this is his only form of income.  That is why he wants to have it in good condition.  He does not want to lack food in the coming months.  

Gabino wants to get ahead and improve his son’s quality of life.  This way, in the near future, his son will able to study for a professional career.  Then Gabino will buy a new moto taxi because his is very old, and it is deteriorating.

loans.use: to buy tires, to buy tools, and to perform general maintenance on his moto taxi.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 45 años, vive con su esposo y tienen dos hijos en las edades de 19 y 22 años. Ella  y su esposo tienen una piladora de maíz, mediante el cual realizan la tarea de trillado y lo venden, así como también lo comercializan entero,   oficio que aprendieron por tradición familiar con sus respectivos  padres. Quienes desde hace 12 años se lo vendieron  y desde ese momento, esta pareja se dedicó a la  actividad, con la que hoy  generan los ingresos para sostener su hogar, dependiendo  totalmente de ella.  Su meta es ampliar la posibilidad de comprar maíz,  para generar mayores utilidades y lograr la sostenibilidad esperada. En la actualidad Maria está aplicando a un credkiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen maíz, para ofrecer mejores precios, pues  con este sistema de compras obtiene descuentos. También planea abordar un nuevo mercado, comprando para la venta  ñame y plátano, pues tiene pedidos que esperan ser cumplidos. El éxito de esta inversión es que conoce muy bien su clientela y trabajará sobre pedidos de sus mejores compradores a crédito.
texts.en:
Maria is 45, she lives with her husband, and they have two children of ages 19 and 22. She and her husband have a corn husking machine, which they use for threshing. They sell the threshed corn and also market it whole. They learned the trade by family tradition, from their respective parents, who sold it to them 12 years ago. From that point on, the couple have been in this business, which they fully rely on today, since it generates the income to support their household.
Her goal is to expand their capability to purchase corn, in order to generate larger profits and achieve their desired sustainability. Currently Maria is requesting a Kiva loan, which she will use to purchase larger amounts of corn. Buying this way provides her with discounts, which will allow her to offer better prices.
She is also planning to tackle a new market, purchasing yams and plantains to sell, for she has orders waiting to be filled. The success of this investment is that she knows her customers very well and she will base her work on orders from her best charge buyers.

loans.use: to purchase larger amounts of corn, yams, and plantains.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, dairy products, beans, flour, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Eda Maria

texts.es: Eda Maria mujer con iniciativa propia y con una familia hermosa, a la edad de 60 años, cuenta con su propio negocio el cual es el alquiler de dos cuartos en su casa de habitacion, negocio que le ha generado cubrir algunas de sus necesidades personales, asi como tambien necesidades basicas del hogar. Dentro de sus prioridades mas apremiantes esta la construccion y ampliacion de un cuarto mismo que le permitira aunmentar el precio del canon de arriendo y de esta manera brindarles a sus arrendatarios mejores condiciones de alquiler, ya que mediante esta infraestructura ofrecera habitaciones mas amplias, confortables, seguras y modernas. Es por ello la razon de este nuevo ciclo de credito que le conllevara a realizar las compras de los siguientes materiales de construccion tales como: cemento, hierro, arena, piedra, piedrin, bloques entre otros. Agradece la confianza dada por kiva a su persona.
texts.en:
Eda Maria is a self-starting woman who is 60 years old and has a lovely family. She runs her own business out of her home renting two of the rooms in the house. This business has allowed her to cover some of her personal expenses and some expenses for her home.

One of her most pressing needs is the construction and expansion of one of the rooms in her house, which will allow her to increase the price she charges for rent, and provide better conditions for her tenants. With this improvement in infrastructure, she will be able to offer large, comfortable, safe and modern rooms.

For this reason, she desires to purchase construction materials such as: cement, iron, sand, stones and blocks, among other items. She is grateful for the trust and support Kiva has given her.

loans.use: to construct and expand a room in her home.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 61 years old, and he and his wife Anna have six children. He is a scrap metal dealer and has been in the business for the past three years.

Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by a client, and this is his first loan with KADET. He will use the loan to purchase more stock of scrap metal for resale.

His hopes are to expand his business and employ more people.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal for sale.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen, 63, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing agricultural crops for over twenty years and are successful in their career. Additionally, her husband runs a business purchasing cattle for resale. This generates more income to support the family. They earn approximately 8 USD per day. Her two children are employed in a garment factory, and they earn about 5 USD per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Sen is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to raise capital for her husband's cattle business. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to raise capital for her husband's cattle business.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
This borrower’s name is Meas, a resident who has been residing in Kompong Cham province. She is 49 years old and a widowed mother of 2 single children working as servants in Phnom Penh city. As they’re working, they can help their mum earn income and better the living conditions. Both of them received low educations because the family experienced financial need and so they quit studying at the primary school level. 

Meas is in the business of cultivating rice and vegetables. She selects crops to grow based on the season and she has been in this business for more than 21 years. There are many works to do in the field, however, she tries to work hard.

This is her sixth loan from HKL. She has already successfully paid back her previous loans as scheduled, and now she would like to acquire this loan to purchase an additional plot of farmland to improve her business. This will enable Meas to increase her household income.

loans.use: to purchase an additional plot of farmland to improve her business

loans.name: Jacqueline Roxana

texts.es:
Jacqueline, se dedica a la venta de merienda y una tienda, vive con su hijo de 15 años de edad, en casa familiar, desde hace 10 años está dedicada al negocio de merienda.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de gas, maíz, aceite, condimentos, y otros productos para continuar en la preparación de meriendas, esto le dará mayor capacidad para realizar sus ventas diarias. 
La aspiración de Jacqueline es crecer en la tienda, surtirla de mas productos, ya que le dará un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Jacqueline sells snacks and has a store. She lives with her 15-year-old son in the family home. She has been working in her snacks business for 10 years.  

Currently, she is applying for a loan to buy gas, corn, cooking oil, condiments, and other products for continuing to prepare snack foods. This will give her greater ability to carry out her daily sales.

Jacqueline's ambition is to see her store grow, and to stock it with more products, because it will give her greater income.

loans.use: To buy gas, corn, cooking oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es: Carlos Ernesto de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una carpintería en el lugar de su residencia donde elabora mesas, sillas, muebles, entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado la clientela pues todo lo que realiza es de excelente calidad al gusto de la persona y lo vende a precio accesible además el servicio es único siempre está disponible con una sonrisa en el rostro cuando se trata de un cliente; Carlos es un hombre dedicado a su labor con muchas metas por delante, piensa que no hay que conformarse con vivir a rastras, si sentimos el anhelo de volar, el ya emprendió su vuelo por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar madera por mayor, herramienta, etc. Carlos Ernesto tiene fe que así podrá ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Carlos Ernesto is 29 years old, and lives with his life partner and children in their own home. He has a carpentry shop in his house where he makes tables, chairs, furniture and other items. Recently, he has expanded his customer base, since he does high quality work that is tailored to the preferences of each client. He sells his products at reasonable prices, offers excellent service, and is always available to talk to customers with a smile on his face.

Carlos is very dedicated to his work and craftsmanship, and he has many goals for getting ahead. He believes that people do not need to settle for living chained down if they feel the desire to fly. He has discovered the craft that gives him wings, and is therefore requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow him to purchase wood in bulk as well as tools for his carpentry business. Carlos Ernesto has faith that this will enable him to offer his family a full and happy life.

loans.use: to purchase wood in bulk, and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fodder and sheep.

loans.name: Wanyona

texts.en:
Wanyona is 52 years old and married to Mary. They have 4 children. He has been selling watermelons for the last 7 years.

He was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of watermelons to meet the increased high demand.

His hopes are to become a watermelon farmer and to be the leading watermelon supplier and retailer.

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Ton

texts.en: Ton, 61, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over twenty years. They have extensive experience and they are successful in their careers. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Additionally, her husband is a construction foreman. They earn approximately USD 8 per day. In order to improve her husband’s business, Ton is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase construction equipment to use in his work. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business to be able to get larger construction projects.

loans.use: to purchase construction equipment for her husband to use in his work

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 57 years old and is a single mother of five children. She has been selling green peas and potatoes for the past two years.

This is her first loan with KADET. She was introduced to it by a KADET client. She will use the loan funds to purchase more stock of peas for resale.

Susan's hope is to purchase a stall in the market to do her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La Sra. Elsa tiene 58 años  es casada con  hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de  Pedro Lorenzo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elsa utilizara este préstamo para para la compra de mesas y sillas por puesto de venta ya que quiere brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes, por esta  razón solicita este préstamo es mejorar la comodidad de su negocio  y clientela, Elsa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su economía y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su pensión y así incrementar su capital de trabajo y por ende sus ingresos, la Sra. Elsa es una persona muy trabajadora y muy amable, se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brinda la institución.
texts.en:
Elsa is 58, married, and has children. She sells food at her stand located in the town of Pedro Lorenzo. This loan is her first with the institution. Elsa will use this loan to buy tables and chairs for her stand as she wishes to provide greater comfort for her customers. This is why she is applying for this loan to improve her business's customer comfort.  

Elsa faces challenges in her business, such as improving her finances, and will use the profits to improve her eatery, and this way increase her working capital and therefore her income. Elsa is a very hard-working, friendly person, and she is happy about the opportunity that the institution is offering her.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: Ricardo Antonio de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de sorgo y maíz, ya tiene años de experiencia y su labor le ha dado buenos resultados, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues su producto es de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Ricardo es un hombre emprendedor con muchas metas por alcanzar, piensa que el éxito parece estar conectado con la acción, la gente exitosa sigue moviéndose siempre, es por eso que él se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz y sorgo por mayor. Ricardo Antonio tiene la esperanza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ricardo Antonio is 39 years old and lives with his wife and their children. He makes a living cultivating sorghum and corn and has a number of years of experience that have yielded good results. Lately he has attracted more customers thanks to the high quality of his product, accessible prices and excellent service. Ricardo is an enterprising man with many goals to achieve, and he believes success is connected with action. Successful people always keep moving, and that's why he decided to request a loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral that will allow him to purchase seeds for corn and sorghum at wholesale. Ricardo is hopeful this will help him be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for corn and sorghum at wholesale.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is a 37-year-old married lady who lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. 

She has been supporting her family by operating a retail business at a local indoor market since June 2011. She has about 2.4 million MNT in working capital. She usually sells women's bags and hand bags that come from Beijing, China. 

Batjargal is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of bags for the beginning of the spring season,

loans.use: to purchase more bags to sell.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin owns a small business selling snacks, groceries, and beverages from her own house, located in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is 42 years old and married with three school-aged children who totally depend on her income. Sin also works as a local farmer, and crop husbandry is the main business of the whole family. She grows rice, potatoes, and vegetables based on the season and the market demand.

Sin has applied for a loan through HKL to rent a medium-sized plantation from other villagers to grow potatoes. This loan will enable the improvement of her business. She hopes that she is able to have a good harvest in the coming months.

loans.use: to rent a medium-sized plantation from other villagers to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en: Pictured above is Mustapha, a businessman in Kabala town. A native of Mongo village, the forty-year-old is married to a businesswoman and the couple has one child together. Their child is attending primary school. Mustapha has been a businessman for five years now. He produces and sells balusters. He has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to make more balusters for sale.

loans.use: to make more balusters for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase basic grains, bread, snacks, sausages, soaps, paper, etc.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust, a partner of Kiva.org, is very pleased to present to you Isatu, a businesswoman from the town of Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. Isatu is a native of Sinkunia and she is thirty-eight years old. She is married to a businessman and has three children – two are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Isatu sells onions, flour, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), sugar, salt, bowls, dishes, etc. She has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy food items in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: 32-Señor De Malta Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 32-SEÑOR DE MALTA esta compuesta por once integrantes la presidenta del banco es La Sra. Betty tiene 37 años, no esta casada pero madre  soltera con 5 hijos que son dependientes algunos se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamburguesas su puesto de venta es en su mismo domicilio y ella vive en la zona este de la ciudad de Cochabamba,   este préstamo es su decima primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Betty utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de hamburguesas, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Betty  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son dar una atención de calidad y la competencia, y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, su  sueño para su negocio es contar con un puesto fijo de venta.
texts.en:
The "32-Señor de Malta" communal bank is made up of 11 members. The chairperson of the bank is Betty, 37. She is not married, but is a single mother with five children who depend on her; some are of school age. She makes and sells hamburgers. Her sales location is in her own home, and she lives in the eastern area of the city of Cochabamba. This loan is her 11th with the institution. 

Betty will use this loan to buy ingredients for making hamburgers. The reason for applying for this loan is to increase her working capital. Betty faces challenges in her business, such as giving quality service and dealing with competition, and will use the profits to improve her quality of life. Her dream for her business is to have a permanent sales location.

loans.use: To buy ingedients for making hamburgers.

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es:
Fátima, vive con su madre y una hermana de 13 años de edad, quien está estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, pupusas, destazo de cerdos, ella aprendió de su madre hace 4 años, dedicándose a aprender todo lo relacionado al negocio, su horario es de 10:00am a 4:00pm dependiendo de la demanda.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos para engordar, porque así lograra alimentarlos ella para luego destazar,  espera tener buenos resultados, obteniendo mejores ganancias.
La aspiración de Fátima es crecer en el negocio, poder generar una mejor condición de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Fátima lives with her mother and 13-year-old sister, who is in school. She makes a living selling food like pupusas (similar to tortillas) and pork. She learned the business from her mother four years ago, and dedicated herself to learning everything about the business. She works from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m., depending on demand. Currently, she is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to fatten and then later butcher. She hopes to see good results and increase her profits. Fátima's goal is to grow her business so she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y café tiene mucha experiencia y sabe mantener el negocio últimamente ha tenido más demanda pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Sara es una mujer muy activa y siempre aprovecha todas las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que al vencer sin obstáculos se triunfa sin gloria, quiere triunfar al máximo venciendo todos los retos que se presenten, está determinada, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz y café por mayor. Sara tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sara is 43 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home. She makes a living cultivating corn and coffee. She has a lot of experience and knows how to run the business. Lately she has had more demand since her products are of very high quality and she sells them at accessible prices with excellent services. Sara is a very active woman who always takes on opportunities when they present themselves. She believes that one cannot triumph without overcoming obstacles, and she wants to triumph to the fullest, turning aside all challenges that come along. She is determined, and it's for this reason she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral, which she plans to use to purchase seeds for corn and coffee at wholesale. Sara is confident that in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for corn and coffee at wholesale

loans.name: Marlyn Lissette

texts.es: Marlyn es una joven de apenas 26 años de edad, madre de dos hijos; desde hace tres años aproximadamente que se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva por encargo, negocio que lo incio con el apoyo de Afodenic manifiesta la joven. Su mayor ilusion es un dia gozar de su propio terreno y hacer su casa que sera la mejor herencia que le dara a sus dos pequeños. Siendo este su tercer ciclo de financiamiento lo aprovechara para realizar compras de ropa nueva y golosinas articulos que le haran crecer su inventario y generar mas ganancias. Agradece a la institución por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y a su vez al de su familia, ya que con la llegada de su segundo hijo que apenas tiene cuatro meses necesitara de que sus ingresos sean mayores y su economia mas alentadora.
texts.en:
Marilyn is a young woman, hardly 26 years old, and mother of two children.  For approximately three years she has made a living selling new pre-ordered clothing, a business she began with the support of AFODENIC, says the young woman.  

Her greatest hope is to one day enjoy her own land and make her home to be the best inheritance that she could give to her to little ones.  This being her third cycle of financing, she would take advantage of it by making purchases of new and pre-ordered clothing, articles that would grow her inventory and generate more earnings.  

She is grateful to the institution for supporting the development of her business and at the same time of her family, since with the arrival of her second son who is hardly four months old she will need her income to be higher and her finances more encouraging.

loans.use: to buy clothing and sweets for her business.

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es: Juana Rosa es miembro del Grupo Solidario Dios Proveerá, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Desde muy joven María se dedica a trabajar, hace algunos años atrás ella empezó con el negocio de venta de ropa, es una persona muy luchadora y conocida en la comunidad. Actualmente tiene una caceta de venta de golosinas y una pulpería, la cual atiende con una de sus hijas, los fines de semana se dedica a la elaboración y venta de golosinas de 2:00 pm a 8:00 pm, mientras que de lunes a viernes se dedica atender la pulpería. El préstamo que Juana solicita lo necesita para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de golosinas como ser: tacos, baleadas, tajaditas, pastelitos, entre otros. Cuenta con la ventaja que tiene muy buenas ventas pero una de sus dificultades es que tiene problemas de salud y eso le ocasiona gastos. Su meta es ampliar la caceta donde elabora sus golosinas, para poder tener un lugar adecuado donde atender a sus clientes. María tiene más de trece años de ser clienta de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Juana Rosa is a member of the group Dios Proveerá (God Will Provide). She is 45 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is a merchant. Since she was very young she has been working. Some years ago she started a business selling clothing. She is a very hard-working person who is well-known in her community. Currently, she has a snack stand and a convenience store, which one of her daughters helps tend. On the weekends, she makes and sells snacks from 2 p.m. to 8 p.m., meanwhile she tends to the store Monday through Friday. Juana is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients to make snacks like tacos and other regional delicacies. She has the advantage of having good sales, but some of her difficulties are her health problems and occasional expenses. Her goal is to expand her snack stand so she can have an adequate space to tend to her customers. She has belonged to Kiva partner FAMA for more than 13 years and has always made her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase meats, bananas, lard and other items.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Khady est une serveuse de 26 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Parallèlement, elle pratique le commerce et la vente d’habits et de produits cosmétiques depuis un an. Elle a choisi cette activité de commerce par opportunité et aussi  dans le but de  diversifier ses sources de revenus. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité depuis aout 2006. Elle a déjà remboursé  un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits et de produits cosmétiques à revendre. Son objectif est de développer son   activité de commerce, d’accroitre ses bénéfices pour mieux faire face a ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Khady is a 26-year-old waitress who lives in Senegal.  Meanwhile, and for the past year, she has also been buying and selling clothes and cosmetic products.  She chose this retail activity because the opportunity presented itself, and also in order to diversify her source of income.  

She has been a member of the local UIMCEC branch since August 2006 and has already repaid a previous loan.  

She is requesting a loan of 150,000 CFA francs to purchase some clothes and cosmetic products for resale.  Her goal is to develop her retail business and to increase her profits, in order to better meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa, âgé de 29 ans, est un chauffeur de taxi de profession. Mais cela ne l’empêche pas d’avoir une activité parallèle qui est l’élevage de moutons de race appelé « ladoum ». Moussa est marié et père de famille.
C’est à l’occasion de la grande fête des musulmans appelé Tabaski qui aura lieu dans les mois à venir que les moutons sont vendus considérablement. Avec le crédit qu’il sollicite, il va acheter 2 moutons de race à 150000F CFA l’un ; qu’il pourra revendre au finish entre 300000F CFA et 400000F CFA.
Grace à ce bénéfice et aux revenus tirés de son taxi, il entretien sa famille et satisfait aux besoins quotidiens de cette dernière.Avec l'appui des préteurs il envisage d'agrandir son élevage à un niveau plus élevé.
texts.en:
Moussa, age 29, is a taxi driver by profession.  Meanwhile, this does not stop him from having a second activity: he raises sheep of the "ladoum" (a.k.a. "touabire") breed.  He is married and has a family.

It is during the celebration of Eid al-Adha (called Tabaski in much of West Africa), the important Muslim holiday which will take place in the coming months, that most sheep are sold. 
 
With the loan he is requesting, Moussa will purchase two "ladoum" sheep, at a cost of 150,000 CFA francs each.  He will be able to resell them between 300,000 and 400,000 CFA francs each.  

Thanks to this profit and to the earnings from his taxi business, Moussa provides for his family and takes care of their daily needs.  With his lenders' support, he is planning to expand his farming activity and to take it a higher level.

loans.use: to buy "ladoum" sheep, to raise them and resell them.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 5 enfants, les femmes du groupe Danaya habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Elles font le petit commerce, de fruits, d’habits pour enfants, de friperies, des poissons, des condiments alimentaires, des tissus et pagnes, etc. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Minata (deuxième femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est la vendeuse de friperies du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  1 balle de friperie d’habits pour enfants, sur place auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, au marché et dans les foires des villages environnants, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Minata compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
For the most part married in traditional families and averaging 42 years of age and five children each, the women of the group Danaya all live in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and marriage. They have small businesses involving fruit, clothing for children, second-hand clothing, fish, condiments, fabrics, <i>pagnes<i/> [the colorful cloth of western Africa], etc.  

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Minata (second from the left in the photo) is the one in the group who sells used clothing She intends to use her loan to buy a bale of used children's clothing from local wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she sells retail out of her home and at the nearby village fairs. Her customer base is composed of men and women.

With this loan, Ms. Minata plans on making an average monthly profit of 22,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting household needs in terms of condiments.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina, vive con su hija de 5 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 años de residir en su actual vivienda, ella es sastre, el trabajo lo aprendió por una señora que le ofreció trabajo, actualmente vive de la sastrería para la manutención de su hija, su taller tiene contrato con centros escolares para la elaboración de uniformes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial, este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener una herramienta más para agilizar el trabajo y tener más capacidad para poder tomar más compromisos con los clientes.
La aspiración de Reina es mejorar el taller, haciéndolo más amplio y con mayor capacidad, también quiere tener la oportunidad de recibir más contratos pues esto le generara más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Reina is a single mother who has lived with her 5 year old daughter in their current house for 4 years.  She is a tailor, a profession that she learned from a woman who offered her work.  Now she supports her daughter with  the money that she makes from her shop.  Her workshop has contracts with schools to make uniforms.

She is requesting a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine.  The financing will give her the opportunity to have equipment to make her work smoother and to be able to take more orders from customers.

Reina’s aspiration is to improve her workshop, enlarging it and  giving it greater capacity.  She also wants the opportunity to take in more orders and that will generate more earnings for her family.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 6 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe Soutoura vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, de pommes de terre, d’encens, de bois de chauffe, de savons, des huiles alimentaires et des habits. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 11ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fily (debout au milieu sur la photo) est la vendeuse de pommes de terre du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 tonne de pommes de terre. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans producteurs et des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Madame Fily compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 140.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge  certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The Soutoura group is composed exclusively of married women. Most of the group's 6 members live in traditional families. Their average age is 35 and they have an average of 4 children.

They all live in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali) and met one another through family, being neighbors, and marriage. The group members run small businesses selling potatoes, incense, firewood, soaps, cooking oils, and clothes.

With the goal of growing their businesses, the members joined Soro Yiriwaso and they're in their 11th loan cycle together.

Madame Fily (standing in the middle of the photo) is the potato seller in the group. She would like to use her loan to buy one ton of potatoes. She gets her supplies from farmers and wholesalers. She sells at retail, for cash, and on credit, at home and at the market, to a clientele composed predominantly of women. With her loan, Madame Fily believes she can reach an average monthly profit of 140.000 FCFA which she'll use to reinvest in her business and take care of family needs.

loans.use: Pour  acheter des pommes de terre

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama  évolue dans le volet communautaire dans le quartier ou elle vit. Elle a 46 ans. Elle est veuve et pratique parallèlement   la vente d’huile de palme et de balaies depuis 10 ans. Elle a choisi cette activité de commerce par amour, mais aussi dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle est membre du guichet de la localité de sa zone d’habitation depuis février 2011. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000 frs prévu pour payer une commande de produits qu’elle commercialise. Les revenus qu’elle gagne lui permet de soutenir ses enfants orphelins.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariama works in the community section of the district where she lives. She is 46 years old and a widow. Concurrently, she has been selling palm oil and brooms for ten years. She chose this business for the love of it but also with the goal of acquiring revenues. 

She has been a member of the branch office in her town's residential area since February 2011. She has already repaid a previous loan. 

Ms. Mariama is requesting  a loan of 150,000 francs to pay for an order of merchandise, which she sells. The revenues she earns enable her to support her orphaned children.

loans.use: to pay for an order of merchandise

loans.name: Horongna Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 3 enfants, elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, des fruits et légumes, de céréales, des condiments alimentaires, des chaussures, des bazins, des poissons fumés et séchés et des tissus. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Korotoumou (deuxième femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est la vendeuse de tissus du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 rouleaux de tissus. Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et dans les foires des villages environnants, à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Korotoumou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments. Elle a pour ambition d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
For the most part married in polygamous families and averaging 40 years of age and three children each, the women of this group all live in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and marriage. The group members have small businesses involving fruit and vegetables, grains, condiments, shoes, damask cloth, smoked and dried fish, and fabrics. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Korotoumou (second woman from the left in the photo) is the one in the group who sells fabrics. She intends to use her loan to buy two bolts of cloth. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she sells retail out of her home and at the nearby village fairs. The customer base is composed mostly of women. 

With this loan, Ms. Korotoumou plans on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and covering the cost of condiments at home. Her ambition is to increase her business volume through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE est un groupement de treize personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même village. La représentante du groupe Hounyo (qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée 42 ans. Hounyo est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Akogbèto. Le couple a sept enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Hounyo vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Hounyo n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir aux besoins familiaux, Hounyo vend de l’huile de palme qu'elle produit à base de noix de palme ; et de façon secondaire de la farine du manioc depuis vingt ans dans une région du Benin. Hounyo s'approvisionne dans sa région au Benin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Hounyo s’associe avec d'autres membres du groupement AYIDOTE pour consentir un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
AYIDOTE is a group of thirteen persons whose members live in the same village. The group's representative, Hounyo (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 42 years old and married to a furniture maker by the name of Akogbèto. They have seven children, some of whom are in school. Hounyo lives together with her children and husband and ensures, along with her husband, that the household expenses are covered. 

Hounyo did not attend school. To meet the needs of the family, she sells palm oil, which she produces from palm nuts; on the side, she has been producing cassava flour for twenty years in a region of Benin. She gets her supplies from a region of Benin.

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demand, Hounyo joined the other members of the group AYIDOTE to consent to a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy basins of palm nuts to process

loans.name: Marybel

texts.es: Marybel de 37 años de edad, vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 8 años. Allí ambos,  se dedican a la venta de pescado y de aguacate, la cual desarrollan ambulante en el lugar donde viven y en sectores aledaños. Marybel Vive  en casa de sus padres, con quienes desde sus 7 años de edad, llegó a Barranquilla, procedente de su natal Corozal, en el departamento de Sucre, en la búsqueda de mejores oportunidades de ingresos. Sus compras las realizan de contado en el mercado de la ciudad y vende también de contado, aunque ofrece créditos a pocos clientes. En la actualidad se acerca la semana santa y esta es una época en la cual el consumo de pescado y de ensalada de aguacate se incrementa, y es aquí donde Marybel y su esposo aprovechan para comprar en mayor volumen y lograr ventas superiores a las que usualmente hacen. Pero su capital de trabajo para invertir en mayor volumen en su negocio,  es su mayor desafío, porque ante la creciente clientela su  dinero  se torna insuficiente para lograr responder a la demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará Aguacates y pescado. Su inversión será exitosa porque lo hace en una temporada apropiada al incremento de su demanda y sobre pedidos de sus clientes a quienes quiere complacer con productos frescos y a aun buen precio.
texts.en: Marybel is 37 years old and lives in the south of the city along with her husband and two children, ages 4 and 8.  [She and her husband] sell fish and avocados on foot in their neighborhood and surrounding area.  Marybel lives in her parents’ home, with whom she arrived in Barranquilla at age seven from her native Corozal, within the Sucre department.  They came in search of new earning opportunities.  They make their purchases in cash at the city market and also sell for cash, although they offer credit to a few customers.  Now that the holy week is approaching and this is the season when fish consumption and avocado salad increases, Marybel and her husband take advantage and buy larger quantities and make greater sales than normal.  But her lack of working capital with which to invest in greater volumes is a big challenge, because the money is not enough to respond to increased customer demand.  This is why she’s requesting a Kiva loan.  This is the first loan she’s getting through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy avocados and fish.  Her investment will be successful because she’s doing it at an appropriate time, when her demand and orders from her customers will increase.  She wants to satisfy them with fresh products at good prices.

loans.use: to buy fish and avocado.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Salone Microfinace Trust is very pleased to present to you Sarah, who is a businesswoman in Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. The 39-year-old Sarah is married to a farmer, and the couple has three children – one is attending primary school and another is in secondary school. 

Sarah, a native of Kabala town, sells rice, palm oil, etc. Sarah has been doing business for 11 years now. She has asked for this loan in order to buy more rice and palm oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice and palm oil to add to her business.

loans.name: Yenawa Group
