texts.fr: Le groupement YENAWA est composé de douze personnes qui résident dans le même village et exercent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La  représentante du groupement, du nom de Antoinette  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Antoinette est âgée de 52 ans. Antoinette est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Benoît. Le couple a six enfants dont trois sont à leur charge. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Antoinette vend de l’huile de palme qu’elle produit à base de noix de palme ; et de façon secondaire Antoinette vend des fruits depuis quinze ans dans sa région. Antoinette s’approvisionne dans sa région au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Antoinette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement YENAWA, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group YENAWA comprises twelve persons who reside in the same village and who all have revenue-generating businesses. This is the first time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for boosting their business. 

The group's representative, Antoinette, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 42 years old and married to a farmer named Benoît. They have six children, of whom three are in their care. Some of the children are in school. 

To support herself, Antoinette sells palm oil, which she produces from palm nuts; on the side, she has been selling fruit for fifteen year in her region. She gets her supplies in her region of Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and increasing her sales and her revenues, Antoinette, along with the other members of the group YENAWA, is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy basins of palm nuts to process them into palm oil

loans.name: Suhey Maria

texts.es: Sugey con su anterior credikiva, compró calzado, productos cosméticos y de higiene, ropa y respondió a su clientela con sus pedidos; así mismo invertido en carnes fría productos con excelente aceptación en su mercado. Ella está satisfecha con su negocio y ahora está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará una vitrina, para exhibir sus productos y mercancía de alta rotación como calzado deportivo, ella hará que esta inversión tenga mucho éxito porque tiene mucha experiencia y eso incide en el aumento del volumen de sus ventas y en la saludable recuperación de su cartera, que con créditos sobre sus productos, estará en manos de sus clientes.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Excelente servicios que nos ofrecen para mejorar nuestras vidas a través de créditos y así ampliar cada meta propuesta.”
texts.en: Sugey used her previous Kiva loan to buy shoes, cosmetics, hygiene products, clothing, and fill her customers’ orders.  She also invested in cold cuts and got a good response from her market.  She’s satisfied with her business and is now requesting a new Kiva loan so she can buy a display case to show her bestselling products and merchandise, such as sports shoes.  She will make this investment a success because she has lots of experience in increasing her sales and the healthy recovery of her wallet, by placing products into her customers’ hands through credit.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is, “You provide us excellent services that helps us better our lives through loans, which allows us to expand each proposed goal.”

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Thunny

texts.en:
Thunny is aged 52 and married. She lives with her husband and her kid in a village of the Sa Ang district, Cambodia. She earns a living through selling vegetables in the local market to support the family while her husband, 52, does some planting in the village. Having been in this business for almost 35 years, she can earn up to USD $15 on average per day from her current business, and she can afford to set aside some nearly USD $4 per day. 

This is the third loan for Thunny with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. In the two cycles she has been with VisionFund, the loans have helped her expand her business and enabled her to support her family better. With good business, she is applying for another loan of USD $1,500 to buy more vegetables for resale and to use a portion to buy a vegetable store in the market to sell vegetables. She hopes that this loan will enable her to own a vegetable store so as to increase her vegetable-selling business and make her family better.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale and buy a vegetable store

loans.name: Korkrie Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Korkrie” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 400,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Mohamed is the leader of this group. The thirty-five-year-old is married to a trader, and they have three school-going children. Mohamed has been a businessman for seven years now; he is currently selling clothes for both men and women.  With this loan, Mohamed is going to buy a larger quantity of clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes to add to his current stock

loans.name: Folly Loko

texts.fr:
Loko est un homme âgé de 44 ans. Il est marié å une ménagère. Il a 3 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 8 ans et le dernier a 3 ans.
Loko travaille comme blanchisseur depuis 2000. Il lave et repasse des habits pour tous clients dans sa blanchisserie. Il travaille avec 04 personne. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir servir rapidement tous ses clients.
Loko a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une machine à laver et un fer à repasser. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Loko voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants et leur bien être social.
texts.en:
Loko is a 44-year-old man whose wife is a homemaker. He has three children, all in school. The first child is 8 years old, and the last is 3. Loko has been working in the laundry business since 2000. He washes and irons clothing for customer in his laundry shop. He works with four persons. At the moment, his main difficulty is not being able to serve all his customers quickly. 

Loko has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy a washing machine and an iron. He wants to reinvest in his business. 

In the next few years Loko would like to expand is business. He says he will use the profits to ensure his children education and social well-being.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es: Teófila es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras, tiene 80 años, ella es socia de Finca Perú dese hace 12 años, siempre trabajo con Finca, ella se dedica a la venta de telares y ropa tejida y artesanía, gracias a las capacitaciones de Finca pudo tener varios premios por su trabajo que realizaba y también exportaba, ahora a los 80 años ella sigue trabajando con su esposo, pero ya es menos, siempre trató de hacer las cosas bien y pudo sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos e inculcarles valores que aprendió en Finca. Esta muy agradecida por las cosas que Finca le ofreció como las capacitaciones, los préstamos y el apoyo moral en los problemas que tenía. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de ropa, telares e hilos.
texts.en: Teófila is a member of the Palmeras communal bank.  She’s 80 years old and has been involved with Finca Peru for 12 years.  She sells knitted fabrics, clothing, and arts.  Thanks to the training through Finca, she was able to win various prizes for the work she did and exported.  Now, at 80, she continues to work with her husband.  She’s always tried to do things well and was able to get her six children ahead and instill upon them the values she learned at Finca.  She’s very grateful for the things that Finca gave her, such as training, loans, and moral support with her challenges.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in clothing, fabrics, and thread.

loans.use: to buy clothing, fabric, and thread.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Houn, age 34, lives with her husband and five single children in the Batey district of Kompong Cham province. She works in the same type of business as her husband. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income. Houn is diligent in her work and tries hard to provide her children with an education, so that they may have good jobs in the future and avoid physical work. 

In order to improve her business, Houn would like to borrow a loan from Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) and Kiva to purchase a threshing machine to use in her business. Also, she can use it to provide threshing services to local farmers in exchange for money or rice. She hopes to earn a better living from this investment.

loans.use: to purchase a threshing machine to use in her business.

loans.name: Takili Finoh Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Takili Finoh” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. The forty-year-old is married to a trader, and the couple has three children. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for eight years now, she sells market-food: pepper, onions, salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy pepper, onions, salt, margi, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresiah is 40 years old and married to Daniel. They have two children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is her first loan with Kadet ltd .She was introduced by a Kadet client. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

Her hopes are to purchase another plot of land to expand her farming output.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Ta Marr Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Ta Marr” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Kumba is the leader of this group. Kumba is 40 years old. She is married to a trader, and the couple has four children – one in primary school, two in secondary school and one not of school-going age. Kumba sells salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, fish, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 11 years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, fish, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy salt, margi, onions, fish, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Makhsud

texts.ru: Махсуд активный и умный юноша, ему 22 года. С детства помогал родителям. Более 3-х лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. В настоящее время Махмуд хочет развивать свой бизнес в сельской отрасли. Для того чтобы его бизнес процветал он обратился в «ИМОН Интернешнл»  для получения займа. Он хочет расширить бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. У него хорошая кредитная история. В будущем он хочет жениться и на полученную прибыль сыграть свадьбу. Махсуд запрашивает займ для покупки семян, горюче-смазочных материалов, селитры и оплаты труда работникам.
texts.en: Makhsud is an active and smart young man. He is 22 years old. He has been helping his parents since he was child. For over three years he has being growing farm produce. At present Makhsud would like to develop his agricultural business. In order to succeed in his business, he turned to IMON International for a loan. He would like to expand his business and earn   good revenues. He has a good credit history. In the future he would like to get married and use the revenues to pay for his wedding. Makhsud is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fuel, lubricants, and saltpeter, and to pay the cost of   labor.

loans.use: to buy seeds, saltpeter, fuel and lubricants.

loans.name: Tawopsu Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tawopsu” group. They are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Mariatu is the leader of this group. She is forty-two years old and married with three children who attend primary and secondary schools. Mariatu sells cooking oil, salt, pepper, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, garden eggs, etc. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying a larger quantity of cooking oil, salt, pepper, Maggi cubes, onions, garden eggs, etc. to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of cooking oil, salt, pepper, Maggi cubes, onions, garden eggs, etc. to add to her business.

loans.name: Palmas Group

texts.es:
Lelis Mirania, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, madre de 2 hijos y junto a su familia reside en el municipio de Tocoa. Ella inició su vida laboral vendiendo huevos con un inventario de seiscientos lempiras y ahora en la actualidad maneja un inventario de veinte mil lempiras. Vende de forma ambulante y su jornada laboral inicia a las 6:00 am y culmina a las 4:00 pm.vLelis solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de huevos y también en aceite de cocina, churros y pan; ya que a través del apoyo de los préstamos que ha obtenido ha ido diversificando y agregando productos a su venta diaria.
Su sueño es tener un local propio para ya no andar en las calles vendiendo y exponiéndose al clima y a la inseguridad. Lelis espera cumplir puntualmente con el compromiso de pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lelis Mirania is 32 years old, she is married and the mother of 2 children. She lives with her family in the municipality of Tocoa. She started making a living selling eggs with an inventory of six hundred lempiras [Honduran currency] and now she manages an inventory of twenty thousand lempiras. She sells as a street vendor and her work day begins at 6:00 am and ends at 4:00 pm. Lelis is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of eggs, also cooking oil, snacks and bread since she has been able to diversify and add products to her daily sales with the support of the loans she has received.
Her dream is to have her own food stall so she doesn't have to travel the streets and expose herself to the weather and the lack of safety. Lelis hopes to fulfill with the obligation of her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, cooking oil, bread and snacks

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
A villager in a village located in an area of the Sa Ang district, Khorn is aged 52 and married. He has four children but only two of them (one daughter and one son) are still dependent on him. His son is still in school while his daughter is at home helping with the family's housework and business. Khorn and his wife earn a living through planting cabbage and pepper. He has been in this business for 30 years. 

Khorn has been with VisionFund for 1 year. The loan has helped him to send his son to school and support his family better. Now he is requesting another loan with VisionFund of US $1,000. He is going to use this loan to buy cabbage seeds and gasoline to carry water for his vegetable plantation. This loan will enable him to grow more healthy cabbage. He hopes to earn more income and keep his son in school.

loans.use: to buy cabbage seeds and gasoline for his vegetable plantation.

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr:
Folly est un homme âgé de 48 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 4 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 26 ans et le dernier a 13 ans.
Folly travaille comme blanchisseur depuis 1986. Il lave et repassage des habits pour tous clients dans sa blanchisserie. Il travaille avec 05 personnes. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir servir rapidement ses clients.
Folly a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une machine à laver, un séchoir et un fer à repasser. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Folly voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de mettre sa famille à l’aise.
texts.en:
Folly is a 48-year-old man.  He married to a retailer.  He has four children, all of whom attend school.  The eldest is 28 years old, and the youngest 13.

Folly has been a laundry worker since 1986.  He washes and presses clothes for all of his clients out of his laundry shop.   He works with five other people.  At the moment, his biggest challenge is that he cannot serve his clients quickly.

Folly is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase a washing machine, a dryer, and a pressing iron. He would like to reinvest in his business.

In the coming years, Folly would like to increase the size of his business.  With the profits, he says that he plans to put his family at ease.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine and pressing iron.

loans.name: Zoila Guadalupe

texts.es: Zoila Guadalupe de veintidós años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijas, Ella posee una venta de cosméticos y ropa en un local que se encuentra en una zona muy transitada del lugar donde vive, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene mucha experiencia con las ventas, además los productos que comercia son de primera calidad y los vende a precios accesibles; Zoila es una mujer que le gusta aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presentan para llegar a futuro a cumplir sus objetivos, piensa que la victoria se consigue con la constancia es por eso que está empeñada en hacer crecer su negocio y por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cosméticos y ropa por mayor a fin de generar mayores ganancias. Zoila tiene confianza que así podrá otorgarle a su familia una vida digna.
texts.en: Zoila Guadalupe, who is 22 years old, lives with her life partner and their daughters. She sells cosmetics and clothing at a location in a very busy zone in the place where she lives. She has acquired many customers, since she has a lot of experience with sales. In addition, the products that she sells are of first quality, and she sells them at reasonable prices. Zoila is a woman who likes to take advantage of all the opportunities that are presented to her in order to reach her objectives in the future. She thinks that victory is achieved through perseverance, and it is for that reason that she is focused on making her business grow. That is why she is applying to Apoyo Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy cosmetics and clothing wholesale, with the goal of generating larger earnings. Zoila has confidence that this way she will be able to grant her family a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Griselda Yamileth

texts.es:
Griselda, vive acompañada con su  esposo y un hijo de tres años de edad, ella administra una tienda de productos domésticos de la cual apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene dos años en el negocio, surgió por ideas de ella y su esposo, atiende de lunes a sábado.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de sodas, boquitas, jugos, dulces, para  incrementar la mercadería en el negocio, con el inventario surtido para atender la demanda de los clientes.
La aspiración de Griselda es estabilizar el negocio, para poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Griselda lives with her husband and her 3-year-old son.  She runs a store that offers domestic products, which she does to support her husband with household expenses.  

She has had the businesss for two years.  She and her husband came up with the idea.  She works at the store Monday through Saturday.

She is asking for the loan to buy soda, snacks, juice and sweets to increase the business's merchandise and inventory assortment, in order to meet her customers' needs.

Griselda's hope is to establish her business so that she and her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy sodas, snacks, juice and sweets.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
El señor Florentino tiene 59 años de edad vive en el  municipio de Chimoré de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  es casado pero su esposa vive y trabaja en España sus hijos son independientes, trabaja como agricultor en su Chaco, el señor Florentino  es un productor de banano y otras frutas.
Florentino es una persona muy trabajadora conocida,  como ahora sus hijos ya son independientes Florentino se siente solo, por la necesidad económica su esposa se vio obligada a viajar a España para poder trabajar,  pero  el cliente enfermo de dengue y se descuidó de su actividad.  Solicita un crédito porque le falto dinero para la compra de un cable vía (estructura metálica) que le servirá para jalar la fruta, ya que el señor florentino ya no cuenta con las energías con la que trabajaba hace años, y este cable vía le hará producir en mejor condición y mayor rendimiento. Pues actualmente ya  encuentra mejor de salud y sus días son más tranquilos a lado de sus familiares, trabaja y está en condiciones de seguir haciéndolo por mucho tiempo, pero con el deseo de que vuelva pronto su esposa.
texts.en: Señor Florentino is 59 years old. He lives in the township of Chimoré of the city of Cochabamba. He is married but his wife lives and works in Spain. His children are independent. He works as a farmer on his plantation. Señor Florentino produces bananas and other fruits. Florentino is known to be a very hardworking person. Since his children are now independent, Florentino feels lonely. Because of economic necessity, his wife was obliged to travel to Spain to be able to work, because he became ill with dengue and had to abandon his work. Florentino is applying for a loan because he needs money to purchase a cable way (a metal structure) which is used to pull in the fruit, since he no longer has the energy that he worked with years ago. This cable way will help him produce fruit in better condition and with greater efficiency. Since he is now in better health and his days are more peaceful alongside his relatives, he is working and is in condition to continue doing it for a long time, but with the wish that his wife can return soon.

loans.use: to buy a cable way to pull in the fruit that he produces.

loans.name: Kimemia

texts.en:
Kimemia is 62 years old married to Naomi and they have three children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is his second loan with kadet ltd. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

His hopes are to improve his farming output by  adding another piece of land.

loans.use: Purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a married man. He has a son who is 3 years old. He describes himself as determined and ambitious. He operates a retail stall where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located at a very busy market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of shoes. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more shoes for selling. His business goal is to run two more retail shoe stalls within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for selling.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha is aged 41 and  married. She lives with her husband and two dependent children in a village of the Sa Ang district. Her children are working at the family's business. To support the family, she and her husband have been buying and selling stoves for almost 20 years. 

Pha has been with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, for two cycles. The loans have seen her significantly improve her living conditions. Currently, she is able to earn up to US$15 per day and she saves nearly almost US$10 each day. Now  she is requesting another loan of US$800. She is going to use the entire loan to buy more stoves for sale. She hopes to increase her business and earn a larger income to improve the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more stoves for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth  is a 45 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 22 years. She describes herself as faithful and determined. Ruth operates a grocery stall where she sells onions. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located at a very busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity in the area of operation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more onions for sale. Her business goal is to venture into a new business of rental houses services within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more onions for sale.

loans.name: Development Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Development” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of 2,600,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to develop their respective businesses.

The leader of this group is Adama. Adama is age thirty-seven.  She was born in Bumbuna village but she is currently residing in Magburaka, together with her husband and eight children. Her husband is a security guard and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Adama has been a businesswoman for eight years now. She sells margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, tomatoes, pepper, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy margi, salt, tomatoes, pepper, etc. at wholesale cost to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy margi, salt, tomatoes, pepper, etc. at wholesale cost to add to her business

loans.name: Siek

texts.en:
Siek is now 25 years old, married and has two children. She and her husband are rice farmers who have been cultivating their own one hectare of rice paddy for seven years to make a living. This is the only source of income for her family. Living in the area of the Prey Chhor district, Siek has been challenged by low crop yields from rice farming and a lack of capital to support her primary business. With her current business, she can earn about US$7 per day to feed her family. 

This is the first loan for Siek with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. To overcome the challenges she's faced for several years, she is now applying for a loan of 4,000,000 Khmer riels to buy another plot of farmland to increase her rice farming production. This loan will enable her to increase farming capacity so as to make more rice to make her living better.

loans.use: To buy another plot of farmland to increase her rice farming production

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Magnificat Group

texts.fr: MAGNIFICAT est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des membres de la même famille.  La représentante du groupe du nom de Totchémé Elodie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans. Totchémé Elodie est mariée à un certain Nestor. Le couple a sept enfants à leur charge dont quatre constituent leurs propres enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Totchémé Elodie  vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari et assure ensemble avec lui, les charges de la maison. Totchémé Elodie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Totchémé Elodie a appris la couture et exerce ce métier depuis six ans. De façon secondaire Totchémé Elodie mène comme activité la vente de vivres et des articles de mercerie à son domicile. Totchémé Elodie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Totchémé Elodie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe MAGNIFICAT un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MAGNIFICAT is a group made up of three people coming from the same family.  The representative of the group (pictured with her hand raised), Totchémé Elodie, is 39 years old and married to a man named Nestor.  The couple takes care of seven children, four of whom are their own.  Some of the children are attending school.  Totchémé Elodie lives together with her husband and children. She and her husband both provide for household needs.

Totchémé Elodie left school at the primary level.  To make ends meet, Totchémé Elodie learned how to sew and has now been working as a seamstress for six years.  Totchémé Elodie earns a secondary income as well selling essentials and sewing materials out of her home.  Totchémé Elodie buys her stock at a market in Benin.  

In order to better respond to the demands of her growing clientele and to earn more profit, Totchémé Elodie, along with the other members of the MAGNIFICAT Group, is asking for a fourth loan through ALIDé.  The loans they previously received were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies and grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies in greater quantities in order to get discounts and also to invest in merchandise such as clothing and items for the home which her customers have ordered.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto de cuarenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia. Él se dedica a la venta de leña, sabe que es un negocio muy rentable ya tiene mucha clientela, pues la leña es de primera calidad y la vende a precios bajos, sus compradores siempre quedan satisfechos con el servicio que les ofrece; Carlos es un hombre honrado y muy trabajador, con muchos propósitos a futuro, piensa que para  tener éxito, debes saber qué estás haciendo, te debe gustar lo que estás haciendo y creer en lo que estás haciendo, el cree en su sueño de hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar leña por mayor. Carlos tiene la satisfacción de saber que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos Alberto is 41-years-old and lives with his life partner and his son in his own home.  He works selling firewood and knows that it is a very profitable business as he already has many customers.  His firewood is of the best quality and he sells it at low prices and his buyers are always satisfied with the service he offers.  Carlos is an honorable and hard-working man with many plans for the future.  He thinks that in order to be successful you must know what you are doing, like what you are doing, and believe in it.  He believes in his dream of making his business grow and this is why he is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow him to purchase firewood at wholesale prices.  Carlos has the satisfaction of knowing that through this he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy firewood at wholesale prices.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive con su compañera de vida  y sus hijos en su humilde vivienda en zona rural, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, sorgo y frijol tiene muchos años de experiencia en este negocio y está muy orgulloso del trabajo que ha logrado, en estas vacaciones ha aumentado la demanda y no quiere decepcionar a sus clientes pues son la razón de ser de sus ventas, todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a excelentes precios; José es un hombre muy dedicado a su labor y entregado a sus sueños, piensa que el éxito lo obtienen aquellos que están seguros de él,  está totalmente seguro es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol y sorgo de primera calidad para que su cosecha sea la mejor. José Luis tiene la esperanza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Luis is 42-years-old and lives with his life partner and their children in his humble home in a rural area.  He works growing corn, sorghum, and beans and has many years of experience in this business.  He is very proud of the work he has accomplished and in these vacation times demand has increased and he doesn’t want to disappoint his customers as they are the reason behind his sales.  Everything he sells is of very good quality and he sells it at excellent prices.  José is a man who is very dedicated to his work and committed to his dreams.  He thinks that success is reached by those who have confidence in themselves and this is why he is requesting a loan from Integral which will allow him to buy corn, beans, and sorghum seeds of the best quality so that his harvest will be better.  José Luis hopes that in this way he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, bean, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Faïda, sont toutes des femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font de la restauration, le commerce d’habillements et de parures.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Faïda sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                   
La cliente ASSAN, première personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter un sac de riz de 100 kilos,10 litres d’huile, 15 kilos de viande, un sac de sel de 25 kilos  avec les fournisseurs de Konobougou pour ensuite vendre après préparation des plats alimentaires,  pendant les jours de foire au marché de Konobougou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de poisson.
texts.en:
The members of the Faïda group are all married women, averaging 33 years of age and 3 children each.  They all live in extended traditional families in the town of Konobougou, in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali).  They know each other through family, friendship and neighborhood ties.  They prepare meals, sell clothes and jewelry.

This is their fourth solidarity loan.

Assan, the first woman from the left in the photo, is planning to buy one 100 kg bag of rice, 15 kg of meat, and one 25kg bag of salt from suppliers in Konobougou.  With these supplies, she will prepare meals that she will sell on market days at the Konobougou market.  Her customer base consists of men and women.  She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 60,000 CFA francs, which will be used to take care of her family's needs, while a part of her earnings will be reinvested in fish retail business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 32-years-old single woman. She has a son who is 12 years old. She describes herself to be humble, social and principled . She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to expand the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for selling. Lucy's dream and  business goal is to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Kasor

texts.en:
Age 30, Kasor is the mother of two dependent children who are too young to go to school. She lives with her husband and children in a village located in the Sa Ang district. She sells food in the village while her husband is a construction builder. She has been in this business for almost 30 years to support her family. Sometimes, they work for others to gain additional income.

Kasor has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely repaid the loans with VisionFund. The loans have enabled her to increase family's income and afford sufficient food to eat. She now can earn up to US$18 from her current business and is able to save around US$6 each day. Now requesting another loan of US$700 with VisionFund, she plans to use the loan to buy more construction materials such as sand, metal, cement etc. and use a portion to increase her food business. She hopes to increase her business to earn more income and send her two children to school when they are at school age.

loans.use: To buy more construction materials and to increase her food business.

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en:
Waseem lives in Gaza and has managed a grocery store since 2008. His store is well-located as it is next to a major souk (market). He is taking out a loan from Ryada to purchase a greater variety of goods for his store to resell to his customers.

Waseem is 29 years old and has a fianceé. He hopes to have a wedding and start a family soon. This loan will allow him to increase his business activity and income, which he will use towards realizing his goal.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of goods for his store.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en: Alfreda is from Sta Cruz, Tangub City. She is 44 years old. Alfreda is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Alfreda owns and operates a banana production business. Alfreda has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Alfreda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfreda is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm chemicals. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is from the village of Rang-ay. She is 49 years old. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nora sells different kinds of fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 300 PHP a day for these activities.

At this time, Nora wants to borrow PHP 10,000 to purchase different kinds of fish such as, tilapia, bighead and milk fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish such as, tilapia, bighead and milk fish to sell.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir owns a metal workshop in Gaza. He is taking out a loan to buy a welding machine for his workshop. The new machine will increase his production capacity and, therefore, his income.

This loan is enabling Bashir to increase his income, which he is saving for marriage and starting a family. He is 21 years old and a secondary school graduate.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine for his workshop.

loans.name: Juah

texts.en:
Juah lives in Compound #3, and she is 50 years old. She did not go to school. She is married with four children between the ages of 23 and 34. They are  living on their own, working and attending school. 

Juah has been selling dried and fresh fish since she was at the age of 9. She is requesting a loan to buy more dried and fresh fish for her business. She faces problems during the rainy season. She enjoys her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried and fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Naing's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Tbaungh Khmum district, Naing is a 37-year-old mother of two daughters who are still in school. Rice farming is the primary source of income for her family to support their living. To earn more income, she plants some cassava on her 0.5 hectare of farmland. She has been in this business for 12 years. Currently, she can earn about US$3 per day from her business. 

This is her second loan with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, with her group of two female members. After successfully paying back the first loan, she could afford to buy a small plot of farmland for a plantation. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. She is requesting 1,000,000 Khmer riels while her group member, Ream, is requesting 1,200,000 Khmer riels. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income and keep her daughters in school until they finish.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mun's Group

texts.en:
Mun is 42 years old, married, and has three children (one daughter and two sons). They all are still dependent on her and still in school. She lives in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district, farming rice as the primary source of income to support her family. She has been farming her one-hectare of farmland for 12 years. With her current business, she can earn about US$3.5 per day and manages to save about US$1 each day for the future. 

Mun has been with VisionFund for one cycle and successfully repaid the loan with VisionFund. The previous loan has enabled her to afford to buy a small plot of farmland. She and her group member, who is just with VisionFund for this loan cycle, are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 Khmer riels and 500,000 Khmer riels respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and earn more income to keep her children in school until they finish.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Yankafisa Group

texts.en: Farah is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. He was born in northern Sierra Leone thirty-three years ago. He is married to a housewife with no children. He is a carpenter and has been in this profession for twelve years now. With the help of this loan, Farah is going to buy working materials like board in order to make a lot of furniture to sell.

loans.use: to buy working materials like board in order to make a lot of furniture to sell.

loans.name: Sabumorgie Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Sabumorgie” group from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Tenneh is the leader of this group. This thirty-five-year-old is married to a businessman and they have six children. Tenneh has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells planks. With her share of this loan, she will buy planks in large quantity to sell in the capital city, Freetown.

loans.use: to buy planks in large quantity to sell in the capital city, Freetown.

loans.name: Best Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Best” group from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businessmen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of 2,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Suliaman. He was born in Kabala town about fifty-four years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children, three of whom are attending primary schools. Suliaman sells roast meat. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy more meat to roast and sell.

loans.use: to buy more meat to roast and sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa cooks banku and she serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Dompoase near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has six dependants. Adjoa has been in this business for 10 years now. She uses her income for the general up keep of her children. Adjoa will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku to sell. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Isha.  She is married and has four children, aged 15, 11, and 4 years, and a 9-month-old baby. 

In 2000, Isha established her business. She began her business because, after dropping out of school, she joined her poor mother in business and with the small profit she made, she started her own business.  Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Isha has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase 25 bags of onions @ Le 80,000, and sachets of milk -- 4 cartons @ Le 490,000. The balance Le 40,000 is used for Transportation.

In the future, Isha plans to open a rice store outlet.  Competition is great but she buys more goods to beat the competition. She is hardworking and committed and she is expanding every year. She hopes to receive more credit from ARD to realize her dream.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase onions - 25 bags @ Le 80,000, and sachets of milk - 4 cartons @ Le 490,000.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be honest and hardworking. She operates a food stall where she sells food such as chips, doughnuts etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located near a school and her primary customers are students and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to expand the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients. Her business goal is to venture into a potato retail business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is 35 years old, married to Rachael, and they have four children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past two years. This is his first loan with KADET ltd. He was introduced by a KADET client. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and potato seeds to plant. His hopes are to increase his farmland in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Gbessay

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Gbessay. She is married and has six children aged 23, 17, 13, 12, 5 and 3 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because he is an orphan. In 2002, Gbessay established her raw fish business. She began her business just to develop herself and provide a livelihood for her family. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,800,000 Sierra Leone leone (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Gbessay requires a loan in order to buy raw fish for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Gbessay plans to build a house, buy a car and a motor bike and to give her children a quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy raw fish for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi is a married woman. She has 2 children, ages 9 and 17 years. She describes herself to be focused, customer friendly and independent. She operates a retail store where she sells handbags. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that sometimes customers delay payment. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy bags to sell. Mwanaidi's dream and business goal is to run a boutique within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy bags to sell.

loans.name: Unisa

texts.en:
This is 37 year-old Unisa. He is married and has 2 children ages 12 and 3 years. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him and assist him in the shop. In 1997, Unisa established his provisions, soap, and cigarette business. He began his business to enable him to abandon a shepherd job. 

This business is the only source of livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Unisa has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy cigarettes, mayonnaise, sardines, milk, and soap.

Unisa hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately  400,000 SLL. In the future, Unisa plans to own a house, to establish a larger business, and to travel to the holy land of Mecca. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy provisions, soap, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Abu. He is married and his spouse is purely a housewife. They have 3 children ages 10, 7 years and 2 months.Two of their children go to school. Abu has one additional dependent who lives with him to assist in his business.

In 2001, Abu established his business selling A4 paper, ledger books, paper files, plastic files, markers, flip charts, chalk, staplers, and paper punches.  Working 7 days week and 9 hours a day, he earns about 2,330,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business.

Abu would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.  Abu requires a loan in order to purchase the following items:  A4 papers - 20 cartons @ 87,000 SLL; chalk - 6 cartons @ 160,000 SLL; staplers - 4 cartons @ 150,000 SLL; and markers - 50 dozens @ 14,000 SLL.

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. In the future, Abu plans to educate his children to university level, build a house, and expand his business in different areas.  He feels good about taking the loan because all business people need loans and this loan will help him to improve the business.

Abu's major problem is frequent increase in rent. Competition is high but he is different from competitors because he does photocoping, laminating, and binding of documents. He serves 50 customers per day.  His business is popular because the photocoping and the items he sells are in use by a majority of people. Abu is assisted by family members. His suppliers are located in Freetown. He transports his supplies by public vehicle and travels twice in a month to get his goods. He puts back his profit into the business, he plans to expand the business, which can be achieved by proper use of capital and profit. He is a hardworking and trustworthy businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy A4 papers - 20 cartons @ Le 87,000, chalk - 6 cartons @ Le 160,000, staplers - 4 cartons @ Le 150,000 and markers - 50 dozens @ Le 14,000.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra de 22 años madre de dos niños en las edades de 4 y 6 años, se  dedica a la venta de mercancías variadas,  en especial Champoo y desinfectantes, en  los barrios  del municipio de Galapa. Su negocio lo inició para apoyar el bienestar de su familia y esto es lo que justamente ha logrado, porque con sus ingresos ayuda en los gastos de sostenimiento del hogar, así como lo hace su cónyuge que se dedica al oficio de moto taxista. Sandra trabaja diariamente con mucho esmero y quiere hacer crecer su negocio, surtiéndolo mucho más, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para hacerlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen y en diferentes unidades de medidas, champoo y desinfectante; con ello logrará, aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y así mismo sus utilidades, lo que se constituye en él éxito de su inversión, pues su  margen de rentabilidad es adecuado, teniendo en cuenta el tipo de negocio  y que el objetivo de esta compra es lograr adquirir estos productos en mayor cantidad para disminuir sus costos y tener mayor variedad en sus especificaciones. Su sueño mas adelante es ser una profesional del derecho y fortalecer su microempresa para hacerla cada vez más sostenible.
texts.en: Sandra is 22 years old and the mother of two children, aged 4 and 6. She sells different merchandise, especially shampoo and disinfectants, in the neighborhoods of the town of Galapa. She started her business to support her family's wellbeing and that is just what she has done. Her income helps to support the home, as does her husband's. He is a motorcycle taxi driver. Sandra works very hard every day and she wants to grow her business and stock it much more, but she doesn't have enough working capital to do it. This is what she has taken out a Kiva loan, the first one she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy larger quantities and different sizes of shampoo and disinfectant. In this way, she will increase her sales and therefore her profits, thus making her investment successful. Her profit margin is adequate, bearing in mind the type of business it is. The objective of this purchase is to acquire the products in larger quantities to lower her costs and have more variety according to her specifications. Her dream for the future is to be a lawyer and and strengthen her micro-business to make it more and more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and disinfectants in greater quantities and different sizes.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 39 years old and a single mother of five children. She owns a food kiosk and has been in operation for 20 years, earning a monthly income of 9,500 KES. 

This her first loan with KADET of 30,000 KES, she plans to use the amount to purchase cooking fat, wheat flour, maize flour, maize, beans, rice, and tea leaves. She will plough back the anticipated profits into the business and educate her child.

Her dream is to grow her business and expand to other areas.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her business

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 62 years old, married and supports a family of 6. Philip owns a posho (maize) mill and has been in operation for a period of 5 years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

He is servicing his first loan from KADET LTD for 30,000 KES and intends to use the money to purchase dry maize for his posho mill. The amount will be used to repay the loan and for his family's upkeep.
 
His dream is to expand the business into other locations.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es: Rosa Lilian se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora. Posee una  tiendita en la cual ofrece variedad de productos de uso diario como: jabón, detergente, aceite, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, etc. ha luchado mucho para lograr mantenerla en marcha y gracias a su arduo trabajo ha logrado mantenerla a flote pese a la competencia que cada día es más fuerte. Es una mujer muy conocida  en la zona ya que es muy amable honesta y responsable. Ha sabido ganarse la confianza de las personas las cuales cada día la prefieren más. Con mucha confianza en Dios ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio para incrementar su inventario de tal forma que los clientes siempre encuentren lo buscan. Todo esto lo hace con el objetivo de incrementar su nivel de ventas y de ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.  Por lo anterior ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar productos de tienda al por mayor como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, café, pan, golosinas y de mas productos que permitan atraer a más clientes de tal forma que con su trabajo y con la ayuda de Dios pueda lograr el sueño de su vida.
texts.en: Rosa Lilian is known for being an entrepreneurial woman. She possesses a little store where she offers a variety of daily use products like soap, detergent, oil, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, etc. She has fought a lot to keep it going and thanks to her hard work, she has kept it afloat despite the competition that is stronger every day. She is a well known woman in the area since she is very amiable, honest and responsible. She has earned the trust of people who prefer her more every day. With a lot of trust in God, she has decided to invest in her business to increase her inventory so that customers can always find what they're looking for. She does all of this with the objective of increasing her level of sales and income that allows her to improve her quality of life. Per the above, she has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to buy products from a wholesale store like rice, beans, oil, sugar, coffee, bread, sweets and more products that allow her to attract more customers so that with her work and with the help of God she can achieve her life's dream.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, coffee, bread, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Fakher Eddine

texts.en:
Fakher Eddine is a 42-year-old married man, father of three children, who opened his own grocery store 8 years ago. Fakher Eddine also works in transportation. He thought of starting a new stable business to improve his family's living, and the grocery store was the best idea. He is a hardworking man, with a good reputation, who seeks perfection in his business. That's why you can find his store filled with many different items requested by his customers. 

Today, Fakher Eddine is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a luncheon meat cutter necessary for his business. This is his first experience with Al Majmoua. He hopes the future relation will sprout more success.

loans.use: To buy a luncheon meat cutter necessary for his business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 to 5 years. She describes herself to be customer friendly and understanding. Previously, she was involved in tailoring activities. She operates a retail store where she sells juice. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power during cold seasons. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fruits for blending juice to sell. Mariam's dream and business goal is to be a supplier of juice to institutions like schools.

loans.use: to buy fruits for blending juice to sell.

loans.name: Bernerd

texts.en:
Bernerd is a widower, age 57 years old, and has 6 children. He owns a retail shop and has been in operation for a period of 2 years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.  

This is his first loan with KADET LTD of 30,000 KES. He plans to use the amount to purchase paraffin, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, washing detergents, washing bar soaps and bathing soaps, tea leaves and cooking fat. The anticipated profit will be used to repay the loan and for his family's upkeep.

His hopes are to prosper in business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his shop

loans.name: Ana Pastora

texts.es: Ana soltera, emprendedora, comerciante su negocio consiste en venta de mercadería variadas, bisutería y otros. Sus hijos mayores le ayudan con los gastos de la casa. Con el préstamo anterior reparo una parte del techo, siendo en gran beneficio ya que para el tiempo de lluvia no se le pasa el agua. Sus planes es construir por completo su vivienda. Con este ciclo de préstamo comprara materiales para los conductos de agua potables y aguas negras, así también el cambio del techo de la cocina que requiere cambiar. Para cumplir este proyecto nuevo necesita la compra de los siguientes materiales: cemento, tuberías pvc, arena, hierro, golosos, laminas de zinc angulares, cajorold, codos, pegamentos, entre otros materiales.Con estas mejoras lograra alejar las enfermedades y obtener mejor higiene. Agradece a la micro-financiera por el continuo apoyo al mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana is single and an enterprising merchant in her business. She sells varied merchandise, such as jewelry and more. Her older children help her with the household expenses. With the previous loan, she repaired a part of the roof. This was of great benefit since the rain won't come through in the rainy season. Her plans are to finish building her house, With this loan cycle, she will buy materials for potable and waste water. She will also change the roof on her kitchen. To finish this new project, she needs to buy the following materials: cement, pvc tubes, sand, iron, sheet metal screws, angular sheet metal, and glue, among other materials. With these improvement, she will able to avoid illnesses and have better sanitation. She is thankful to the micro-financer for the continuing support to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to put in potable water and a roof on the kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new paddy milling machine

loans.name: Dunis

texts.es: Dunis hace 10 años conoció a su hoy cónyuge, quien trabajaba en una empresa familiar de congelados y le enseñó todo lo que ahora juntos hacen: elaboran n arepas de maíz natural asadas, pasabocas, empanadas, deditos y en general congelados. A este negocio se dedicó con su cónyuge una vez se independizó su cónyuge de su anterior empleo y con ella dio curso libre a su negocio. Ellos con un molino eléctrico, una estufa industrial, poncheras y latas, entre otras herramientas, desarrollan toda una operación productiva: en las horas de la tarde empiezan el proceso de cocción del maíz, elaboración de masas y armado de producto; se levantan muy temprano y a las 4:00 a.m. continúan  las tareas que el día de ayer habían dejado hecha en parte; asan las arepas, envuelven en bandejas y en plásticos transparentes y pasan directo al congelador. Sus principales clientes son colegios, cafeterías, empresas, tiendas y hospitales. Dunis tiene inmensos deseos de tener ingresos para lograr el bienestar de su familia por eso realiza una actividad simultanea que es la de elaborar piezas de hierro, negocio que desarrolla con su hermano. Su mayor desafío es lograr captar muchos mas clientes por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará maíz, queso, en mayor volumen envases desechables, para aumentar la producción de pasabocas, aprovechando que cada vez mas tienen nuevos pedidos y esto hace exitosa esta inversión. El mayor sueño de Dunis es tener su propia casa y brindarle a su hija la mejor educación que le sea posible, por eso se esfuerza con su cónyuge para lograr estos propósitos.
texts.en:
10 years ago Dunis met his spouse who worked in a family frozen food company and taught him everything that now they do together: make grilled, natural, corn arepas, snacks, empanadas, frozen fingers and frozen food in general. He dedicated himself to this business with his spouse once she quit her previous job and, with her, gave free rein to their business.With an electric grinder, an industrial stove, bowls and cans, among other tools, they developed a productive operation: in the afternoons they begin the process of baking the maize, making dough and product assembly. They get up very early and at 4AM conitnue their work that they had started the day before: grilling the arepas, wrapping in trays and in transparant plastic and going straight to the freezer.

Their main customers are high schools, cafeterias, companies, shops and hospitals. Dunis has immense wishes to have income to achieve the wellbeing of his family. For this, he performs a simulataneous activity, which is making iron pieces, a business that he is developing with his brother. His greatest challenge is to find more customers. For this, he is applying for a CrediKiva, the first loan that he's made with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy maize and cheese in greater volume in disposable containers to expand the production of snacks, increasingly taking advantage of new orders and this makes the investment successful. Dunis' greatest dream is to have his own house and to provide his daughter with the best education possible. For this he works hard with his wife to achieve those goals.

loans.use: to buy maize, cheese in greater volume in disposible containers.

loans.name: Obet

texts.en:
Obet is a 35-year-old man. He is married to Aksa, a 33-year-old lady. They have three children namely: Ofni, 10, attending the 4th grade of Elementary School; Barto, 7, attending the 1st grade of Elementary School; and Alfiano, 2 years old. 

To cover his family needs, Obet initiated a poultry business three years ago. He built a stall with the capacity to hold 600 chicks. Obet needs 3 or 4 weeks to raise the chick before selling them. 

Obet intends to purchase six boxes of chicks and to enlarge the cage, but he doesn't have the money to do so. He heard that TLM could provide a loan for the small entrepreneur like him. Obet then applied for a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM for his business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase six boxes of chicks and to enlarge the cage

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia  de 47 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, donde se dedica a la venta de productos mediante guías especializadas, actividad con la que logra sostener  a su hijo de 13 años. Ella aprovecha las promociones para hacer su mejor oferta, visitando cliente a cliente, con el fin de que identifiquen los productos que requieren y a un buen precio. Nidia pasa mucho tiempo trabajando, porque además labora en un hotel y genera otros ingresos;  su actividad comercial se nutre de su vida como empleada, porque allí también logra captar la atención, el interés, el deseo y la acción de compra de nuevos clientes, los que identifica en su gran experiencia. Su negocio poco a poco crece y su clientela pida cada días mas mercancía, pero su capital de trabajo es su mayor desafío, para lograr responderle a sus potenciales compradores. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  accesorios femeninos, cosméticos entre otras mercancías sobre pedidos, para hacer que su inversión sea todo un éxito.
texts.en: Nidia is 47 years old. She lives in the city of Cartagena where she is dedicated to selling products through specialty guides, an activity with which she is able to support her 13 year old son. She takes advantage of the promotions to make her best offer, visiting customer after customer with the goal of identifying the products they needs and at a good price. Nidia spends a lot of time working because she also works in a hotel and generates other income. Her commercial activity draws from her life as an employee because there she also manages to capture the attention, interest, desire and purchasing action of new customers, who she identifies with her great experience. Her business is gradually growing and her customers ask for more merchandise every day. However her working capital is her greatest challenge to respond to her potential buyers. This is the reason why she is approaching CrediKiva for her first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy feminine accessories, cosmetics among other merchandise based on orders, so she can make her investment successful.

loans.use: to buy feminine accessories, cosmetics among other merchandise, under order.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 29-year-old married man. He has a son who is three years old. He describes himself to be focused and humble. He operates a barber shop where he provides hair cuts. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. His business is located near a busy road and his primary customers are local residents. 

Denis describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of electricity. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a shaving machine and pay for the renovation of his business premises. His business goal is to run another barber shop in the central business district of Nairobi city within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy another shaving machine and pay for the renovation of his business premises.

loans.name: Rawlinson

texts.en:
Rawlinson, thirty-seven years old and married, runs a computer services business and has been in operation for three years, earning a monthly income of sixteen thousand shillings.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to purchase more computers.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business to other localities.

loans.use: to purchase more computers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice  is a fifty-four-year-old widow with five children. She has had a rental and boutique business in Uthiru for three years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand  shillings. 


This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to pay her daughter’s school fees. In future she wants to expand her business

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s school fees

loans.name: Klaber Wilfrido

texts.es:
Kleber es un hombre de 47 años que tiene dos hijos. Vive en "Puerto Quito" que es un cantón de la provincia de "Pichincha", donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador. En este cantón se puede disfrutar del turismo comunitario de aventura o de descanso ya que es rico en flora y fauna. Cuenta con varias cascadas y ríos importantes. La gente del sector se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, y entre los productos más destacados está el cacao y las frutas tropicales.

Kleber tiene una propiedad donde tiene sembríos de cacao. Él lo cultiva, cosecha para luego así comercializarlo. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus hermanos hace 20 años y hoy la ha perfeccionado gracias a conocimientos pasados de amigos y familiares. Este emprendedor desea expandir su cultivo y para esto debe invertir en semilla y fertilizante para lo cual necesita de un crédito. 

Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre Kiva y Kleber ha realizado un análisis crediticio en el cual se determina que tiene un bajo riesgo de incurrir en morosidad. Además Fundación Alternativa, le dará asesoría e incluso capacitación con lo cual Kleber podrá tener un desarrollo sostenible y sustentable. 

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos terminando sus estudios. El quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y así sus hijos tengan sus necesidades cubiertas.
texts.en:
Kleber is a man of 47 years who has two children. He lives in Puerto Quito that is an administrative area in the province of Pichincha where the capital of Ecuador is found. In this area, you can enjoy adventure tourism or relaxation tourism since it is rich in flora and fauna. It has various important waterfalls and rivers. The people in the area are dedicated mainly to farming and among the products that stick out most are cocoa and tropical fruit.

Kleber has a property where he has planted cocoa. He cultivates and harvests it to then sell it. He learned this activity from his brothers twenty years ago and today he has perfected it thanks to the knowledge passed from friends and family members. This entrepreneur wishes to expand his farm and for this he ought to invest in seed and fertilizer so he needs a loan.

Fundación Alternativa, which is an intemediary institution between Kiva and Kleber has made an loan analysis through which it has been determined that he has little risk to incur delinquency. Additionally, Fundación Alternativa will give advice and even training with which Kleber will be able to have sustainable and sustained development.

His dream is to see his children finish their studies. He wishes to improve his quality of life and that his children's needs are covered.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to increase the area he has for farming cocoa.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single woman. She has two children, 19 years old and 22 years old. She describes herself to be responsible and organized. She operates a retail business where she sells groundnuts . She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy and viable housing estate  and her primary customers are passersby. 

Christine describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a permanent place for her operation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more groundnuts. Her business goal is to own a permanent stall for her business operation within five years.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts.

loans.name: Napisa

texts.en:
Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Napisa obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid.

She was able to broaden the assortment of goods and obtain new customers. 

Now Napisa has applied for a loan of KGS 80,000 to continue to broaden her assortment of goods and raise her turnover. 

Revenues from this loan will be used for purchasing materials for her house reconstruction.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. 

She owns a salon business. She has been in the business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

This will be Judith’s first loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the loan to purchase more beauty products and open another salon. With the anticipated profit she plans to diversify the business.

Her hopes are to grow and expand the business into several branches.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products and open another salon.

loans.name: La Gloire De Dieu Group

texts.fr: LA GLOIRE DE DIEU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Aimée  (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 56 ans. Aimée est mariée à un certain Alain. Le couple a trois enfants mais seulement deux restent à leur charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Aimée vit ensemble avec les enfants et son mari et assure  avec son mari les charges de la maison. Aimée a arrêté l’école au niveau universitaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Aimée mène comme activité la vente de produits divers et de tissus, des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et des plastiques à son domicile depuis sept ans. Aimée s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin.  Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Aimée sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe LA GLOIRE DE DIEU, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group GLOIRE DE DIEU (Glory of God) consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Aimée, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Aimée, age 56, is married to a man named Alain. The couple have three children, two of them still in their care. All three children have received schooling. Aimée lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle the household responsibilities together. Aimée attended university.

In order to deal with the family expenses, Aimée started selling various products from her home seven years ago including fabrics, mobile phone recharge cards and plastic wares. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.

To meet the needs of a growing customer base and to increase her profits, Aimée is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group GLOIRE DE DIEU. Past loans were repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, plastic wares, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Teto

texts.en:
Teto is 39 years old and married. She sells cereals and has been in the business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of four thousand shillings. 


This is her first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock of cereals for sale.

Her hopes are to expand the business to include wholesaling and retailing cereals.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for sale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has three children. She owns a green grocery. She has been in the business for one year earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

This will be her first loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the loan to stock her green grocery and buy second-hand clothes. With the anticipated profit she plans to build a permanent structure for the business. 

Her hopes is to  provide for her family and become financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her green grocery and second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Mouy

texts.en:
Mouy, 43, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband have been involved in potato cultivation for over four years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Additionally, her husband is a construction foreman. He earns about USD 7 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about USD 2 per day. 

Mouy is asking a loan of USD 1,500 pay for the rent of the land where she is planting potatoes. This money would enable her to acquire security with this agricultural business. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business to generate more income to support the family and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to pay for the rent of the land where she is planting potatoes.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom, 52, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing vegetables to sell for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. All of her children are employed. They are a truck driver, a barber and a fish vendor. Approximately, they earn USD 12 per day.

 In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Sarom is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to raise capital for her child's business for purchasing more fish to resell. This money would enable her child to generate more profit to support the family.
