In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to raise capital for her child's business to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 66 years old and married. He has eight children.

He runs a livestock farming business. He has been in the business for 20 years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

This is his second loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more goats and cows, and with the anticipated profit, he will pay school fees for his children.

His hopes are to be financially stable and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and cows.

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Thavy, 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling fish for over 20 years, earning approximately USD 11 per day. Her husband runs a business of purchasing horses to resell and earns about USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed. They are a construction worker and a horse cart runner. They earn about USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Thavy is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to raise capital in her husband’s business for purchasing horses to resell. By doing so, her husband would generate more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her husband’s business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to raise capital in her husband's business for purchasing horses to resell.

loans.name: Tang

texts.en:
Tang, 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband have been running a rubber plantation for over seven years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Tang would like to run an additional business to generate more income to support the family. Therefore, Tang is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase cashew nuts to resell for a profitable price. 

In the future, she would like to expand her new business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts to resell for a profitable price.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, 59, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling breakfast food (porridge, noodles) for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. All of her children are employed in a garment factory. Approximately, they earn USD 12 per day. 

Due to the difficulty with the family’s transportation, Sok is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the  money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Him, 50, is married and resides with her husband and a daughter in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a retired teacher who can earn about USD 2 per day. Her daughter runs a cosmetic shop in the market. She earns about USD 5 per day. In order to improve her daughter’s business, Him is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more cosmetics for her daughter to resell. This purchase would help her daughter to make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand the business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger to provide enough space for her family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her daughter to resell

loans.name: Dim

texts.en:
Dim is a farmer living in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has dedicated herself to the rice farming business. She has many years of experience doing this business. Kong, her husband is very supportive and helpful to manage the maintenance of the rice field beside construction work. This couple has given birth to two children who are students attending in local state school and in need of daily allowances. 

Dim would like to maintain a sustainable living for the family, and therefore she is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to purchase a trailer, from which vegetables, groceries, and meats can be sold. She believes that most people around the community will buy her products rather than spend time going to the market.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer from which vegetables, groceries and meat can be sold.

loans.name: Rouern

texts.en:
Roeurn, 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing agricultural crops for over twenty years, have an extensive experience, and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Approximately, they earn USD 3 per day. Three of her children are employed in a factory. They earn about USD 10 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her farming work, Roeurn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a pump to pump the water into her rice field. This purchase would help her provide enough water for her plants and get a higher yield. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a pump to pump the water into her rice field

loans.name: Sok Keang

texts.en:
Sok Keang, 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband have been cultivating corn, sesame and beans for over 10 years, earning approximately USD 7 per day. Two of her children are farm workers who earn approximately USD 5 per day. 

Sok Keang is asking a loan of USD 500 to rent the farmland where she is planting her crops. This money would enable her to acquire security for this agricultural work. 

In the future, she would like to purchase farmland and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to rent the farmland where she is planting her crops.

loans.name: Koiy

texts.en:
Koiy, 60, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in animal husbandry and growing vegetables to sell for over five years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a primary school teacher who earns about USD 3 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about USD 9 per day. 

In order to stabilize her family’s living conditions, Koiy wants to run an additional business to generate more income to support the family. Therefore, Koiy is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to purchase silk thread to weave cloth to sell. 

In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and help her youngest child get a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase silk thread to weave cloth to sell

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Huon, age 58, is a mother of a big family with seven children: two single and five married children. She lives in a small village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has been involved in a rice farming business to earn a living. She has fewer duties to look after her children since they are employed and have become independent. 

With the amount she requested from Kiva, Huon will add to her capital to start up a business selling groceries in a local market to improve the household income. Her daughter will also support her in this type of business. She has borrowed four loans from HKL already. This will be her fifth loan given to make a change in her family’s status.

loans.use: to add to her capital to start up a business selling groceries in a local market.

loans.name: Cham

texts.en: Cham, 50, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs a business renting sound equipment.  He earns approximately USD 5 per day. One of her children is a construction worker in Thailand. He earns about USD 4 per day. In order to improve her husband’s business, Cham is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase four more speakers for her husband to rent in his business. This purchase would enable him to provide better service to clients and earn more profit. In the future, Cham would like to use the further profit to expand the business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase four more speakers for her husband to run the business

loans.name: Phoen

texts.en:
Phoen is 43 and a married mother of six children, five of whom are living together with her under the same roof in Batey district of Kompong Cham. Aside from helping her husband in the farming business, she also takes high responsibility for managing household things, taking care of the family and providing a good education to her children. Phoen and her husband work hard to maintain a good quality of life for their children and ensure a bright future for them. Oum, her husband, decided to involve himself in animal trading to increase the family’s ability to cope with financial needs.

Due to the lack of capital, Phoen is asking for an addition of 4,000,000 KHR for her husband to purchase cows for trading. She mentioned that the loan will help her improve the business and thereby increase the family’s household income.

loans.use: to purchase cows for trading.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Samnang, 29, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for over ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 5 per day. In order to improve her business, Samnang is requesting a loan of USD 500 to raise capital for her business to buy all kinds of vegetables to resell. This loan could help her to make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build a new house to provide appropriate living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to raise capital for her business to buy all kinds of vegetables to resell

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha, 30, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been running her parking spot service for over two years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a high school teacher who earns about USD 3 per day. Due to difficulty with the family’s transportation, Sokha is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would help her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child get a Bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan is 50 years old and a loving father of 5 children. He has been residing with his family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. To earn a living, Phan is engaged in animal trading. He buys and sells cows at the market place of the province, earning approximately USD7.20 per day. His wife helps him earn income by raising some piglets at home. This couple has strong commitment to provide their children a good education. 

Phan would like to take this loan to buy construction supplies and pay for workers performing the construction. He wishes to have a nice house, which will provide the entire family with a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and pay for workers performing the construction.

loans.name: No

texts.en: No, aged 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sweetish cake for over seven years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about USD 5 per day. In order to stabilize her family’s living conditions, No would like to run an additional business. Therefore, No requests a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a truck to run a delivery service. This purchase will help her earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to run a delivery service

loans.name: Sophany

texts.en:
Sophany, 44, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in breeding pigs for over four years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about USD 8 per day. One of her children is employed as a team leader in a garment factory and earns about USD 6 per day. 

Due to difficulty with the family’s transportation, Sophany is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the  money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children get a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Reum

texts.en:
Reum, 50, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over two years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about USD 2 per day. In order to improve her business, Reun is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to resell. This purchase would enable her to generate more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger to provide appropriate living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Altantsetseg's Group

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is a 43-year-old widow who lives with her daughter, aged 5, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends kindergarten. 

Altantsetseg supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When she first began her business, she had 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. Now she has 5,000,000 MNT in working capital. She sells jeans and trousers, which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 

Altantsetseg is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more jeans to sell in order to increase her jeans and trousers' variety. Her goal is to expand her business and then to be able to improve her daughter’s education. She is one of our trusted clients who is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

She is the group leader and she is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans and trousers to sell

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin is 43 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and 4 single children in the Prey Chor district, while the other two children are married and live in separate homes.  Sin is in the business of rice farming to earn a living. She is able to generate approximately 1.50 USD per day. 

In the next two months, Sin is going to prepare a wedding party for her third child and she realizes it will be expensive. Due to insufficient capital, Sin would like to ask for a loan to pay for the wedding party preparation. She hopes to get the loan from our lenders and she is confident of paying it back on time as it’s now her fourth cycle loan from HKL. Sin is very thankful.

loans.use: to pay for the wedding party preparation.

loans.name: Nith

texts.en:
Nith, 28, is married and resides with his wife in Kampont Province, Cambodia. He has been running a public transportation service (motor taxi) for over four years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. His wife is a garment worker who earns about USD 3 per day. Since his present motorbike is too old, Nith is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one to run the service.

In the future he would like to drive a Tuk Tuk  (motorcycle with side car) instead of his motor taxi because running a Tuk Tuk earns more money. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one to run the service

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn, 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over twenty years, have extensive experience, and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle. Approximately, they earn USD 4 per day. Three of their children are garment workers. They earn about USD 12 per day. 

Due to difficulty with the family’s transportation, Lorn is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: Nheb, 44, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in corn cultivation for over ten years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about USD 8 per day. Nheb is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a plot of land for constructing a new house. This money would help her to get a comfortable place for her family to live in. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for constructing a new house

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 34 years old. He lives in a village of Khelvachauri District, West Georgia with his family: his wife – Natia and his parents. Guram and Natia are employees of a local company and they get a monthly salary. Along with their main job, they are actively involved in the family agricultural business. They have 0.4 hectares of land, where vegetables, fruit and various citrus trees are grown. Guram’s parents sell harvested fruit and vegetables on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Guram requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. It will be placed in an old cattle-shed, located in the yard of Guram’s house. The family will start production of cheese and they will sell it on local open market as well. The income of the family will increase by 150 – 200 Laris per month. The increased income will allow them to purchase needed additional household goods, to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut is a 46-year-old married woman who has been residing in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is in the businesses of making mortar mill and rice husbandry. This type of business requires her to be more patient. Khut uses the profit she earns from the business to cover her daily expenses.

As of now, she requested a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to purchase a cow for maintenance of the rice field. Khut described that a cow will help her family to make progress in the business, and she can reduce some expenses on the plowing fees. She hopes she will be successful in managing the business someday.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Elsie Yessenia

texts.es: La señora Elsie, habita el la zona Sur de Costa Rica, especificamente en la provincia de Puntarenas, Corredores, Canoas, Paso Canoas,zona caracterizada por presentar bajos indicadores de desarrollo humano, ya que es una zona donde la actividad principal es el cultivo de la palma aceitera, actividad donde predomina la utilización de hombres, para la recolección del fruto, de allí que las mujeres tengan pocas posibilidades de obtener un trabajo remumerado, es por esta razón que Elsie se dedica a la cria de cerdos para engorde, para poder ayudar a su compañero con la economia domestica; este crédito al igual que los que obtuvo cuando era miembra del BM Laskmi, es para la compra de cerdos, concentrados y vacunas, por la duración del ciclo productivo la forma de pago debe ser semestral; con esta actividad asi como con el salario que devenga el esposo, quien es profesor unidocente de una escuela que esta en la linea limitrofe entre Costa Rica y Panama, ha podido tener un hijo en la Universidad estudiando Dirección de Empresas, en la universidad de Costa Rica, donde goza de una beca, la cual no cubre todos sus gastos, de allí que necesite el apoyo de sus padres, para poder concluir sus estudios; asi mismo desea apoyar a su hija que desea estudiar gastronomía, en el Instituto Nacional de Aprendizaje, organismo estatal que enseña oficios, para lograr una incersión al mercado laboral. Tanto Elsie como su esposo estan convencidos que la eduacación dada a sus hijos, es el medio para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elsie lives in the southern region of Costa Rica, specifically in the province of Puntarenas, Corredores, Canoas, Paso Canoas. This is an area that scores low on development indices as it is in area where the main economic activity is cultivating the oil palm, an activity that predominantly employs men to harvest the fruit. This means that the women have few opportunities for paid employment. This is why Elsie works raising and fattening pigs - to help her partner with the household expenses. This loan, like the loans she had when she was a member of BM Laskmi, will be used to buy pigs, concentrate, and vaccines for the duration of the production cycle. She will make weekly repayments. Thanks to her work and the salary that her husband brings in (he is a teacher at a school that is on the border of Costa Rica and Panama) she has been able to send a son to the the University of Costa Rica to study business. He has a scholarship but it does not cover all of his expenses so he needs support from his parents to be able to complete his studies. Elsie also wants to support her daughter who wants to study culinary arts at the National Training Institute, an institution that teaches trades to build-up the labor market. Elsie and her husband are convinced that giving their children an education is the way to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs, concentrates, and vaccines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise (noodles, rice, sugar, cleaning utensils, among other items)

loans.name: Arusik

texts.en:
Arusik is 48 years old. She lives in Akhalkalaki District, South Georgia with her family: her husband – Temur, her 18-year-old son and her 75-years-old mother-in-law. Her son goes to school. 

The family earns their living through their agricultural business. They have three milk cows. Arusik produces cheese and sells it on the local market. Along with the dairy farm the family has a plot of the land where they grow potatoes. In the spring season, Arusik and Temur spend most of their days on their plot, busy with seasonal agricultural work. They harvest potatoes in summer and sell them locally to greengrocery products retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

Arusik requested credit to purchase potatoes for sowing. Also part of the loan will be used for purchasing chemicals to treat the plants against parasites. Arusik and Temur hope that the weather conditions will be favorable and after properly done seasonal work, the family will get a plentiful harvest, which will be sold for a good price. Arusik will reinvest part of the received profit in the same business and will use the rest for financing ongoing family daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing and chemicals for treating the plants' parasites

loans.name: Datuna

texts.en:
Datuna is 37 years old. He lives in a small village in the Zestaponi District with his family: his wife – Khatuna and their three children. Khatuna works as a cleaner in the local school. Datuna leads the agricultural business of the family. They have a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Khatuna produces cheese and sells it on the local market. Also they have a greenhouse with the area of 900 sq. meters. Datuna grows cucumbers in the greenhouse during the whole year. He sells cucumbers to local greengrocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris. 

Datuna requested credit for purchasing cucumber seeds. He will purchase quality seeds and sow them in the greenhouse. Also part of the requested credit will be used for purchasing polyethylene, for covering the greenhouse, as the old cover is already torn and can’t maintain the needed temperature in the greenhouse.

 As a result of the above-mentioned investment, the family will get a plentiful harvest during the year, which will be sold for a good price through already existing distribution channels and the family will get more income than in the previous year. The increased income will allow the family to spend more on family daily expenses and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cucumber seeds and polyethylene for covering the greenhouse

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara is 62 years old. She lives in a village of Zestaponi District with her husband – Gurti. Lamara and Gurti are retired. They earn a living through the family agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm with three milk cows and five calves. Lamara produces cheese and sells it on the local open market. Also Gurti is a worker in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Lamara requested credit for purchasing construction materials for construction of a new, bigger cattle-shed. Their existing cattle-shed doesn't have room for more than three milk cows. The new cattle-shed will allow Lamara not to sell off calves but raise them. As a result of the above-mentioned, in the future the family will have more milk cows and thus get more milk for cheese production. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to purchase additional goods for their household, to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for cattle-shed construction

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 38 years old. She lives in a small village of Terjola District with her family: her husband – Grigol, three children (13, 17 and 19 years old) and her father-in-law (retired). The younger children go to school and the elder one is a student. Grigol works in a local company as an operator. Maya heads up the agricultural business of the family: they have a milk cow. Maya produces cheese and sells it in the village. Also the family owns a vineyard with 1200 grapevines. Maya and Grigol produce wine and sell it in the village. Along with the above-mentioned, the family has 80 nut trees. They sell nuts on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris. 

Maya requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. With two milk cows Maya will be able to produce and sell double the amount of cheese. The monthly income of the family will increase by at least 200 Laris. Maya will use increased income for financing the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal, a 45-year-old resident of Baray district, Kompong Tom province, is married and has four children, some of whom are employed and work in Phnom Penh City, while her youngest attends school and needs daily allowances. A farmer primarily cultivating rice during Cambodia's two growing seasons, Pal would like to improve her farming practices but needs additional capital.

Pal is requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to pay the rent on two-hectare plots of land she farms and to buy potato plants to cultivate. This loan will enable her to ensure the steady progress of her business and thereby increase her household income.

loans.use: to pay the rent on two-hectare plots of land and buy potato plants to cultivate.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es una madre luchadora que saca adelante, sola, a su pequeña de 8 años, la cual se encuentra en el 3º grado de primaria, como madre, ella desea todo lo mejor para su hijita, ya que  con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logrará convertirla en la gran profesional que desea que se convierta.

Maritza ha logrado afrontar muchos retos y toda su fuerza se ha visto enfocada en el cariño que su hijita le da. Para poder salir adelante ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de puercos, a su vez también vende gaseosas y golosinas en una pequeña tiendita que tiene, en la cual trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias.

Ella ha logrado tener mucha acogida debido a que el lugar en donde vende sus productos es muy concurrido. Con un poco de apoyo, Maritza podrá realizar la compra de más gaseosas y golosinas, ya que actualmente sus clientes se han incrementado y necesita un poco más de variedad y desde luego productos. Ella siente que puede ser exitosa, ya que mucha dedicación llegará a cumplir su gran sueño “Tener una gran tienda y que su hija sea una gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Maritza is a hardworking woman who has brought-up her 8 year-old little girl by herself. Her daughter is in the 3rd grade of primary school. Maritza wants the best things for her little girl and hopes that hard work and dedication will enable her to become a successful professional. 
Maritza has faced many challenges and she has put all her focus on the love that she gives to her daughter. To get ahead, she works raising and selling pigs and, at the same time, she also sells sodas and candy from a little store that she has, where she works an average of 8 hours a day.
Her business has been well received because it is in a very busy location. With a little support, Maritza could sell more sodas and candy as her clientele is currently increasing and she needs a little more variety and more products. She feels that she can be successful and, with dedication, she will achieve her dream: "to have a big store so that her daughter can be a successful professional."

loans.use: to buy soda and candy.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun is 45 years old and married to Sang. They have four children, three of whom are single and live together with their parents. Kun owns a few hectares of land on which she plants and cultivates rice. Kun uses traditional methods she learned from her ancestor to do farming. However, she works hard and obtains a good result from the harvest. Farming is the only source of the family’s income. She has been in the business for almost 22 years.

Kun would like to acquire some funds to purchase cashew nuts to stock so she can resell them to make more profit in the future. Someday, with her determination, Kun hopes to achieve economic stability and ensure a bright future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts to stock.

loans.name: Saing

texts.en:
Saing is 32 years old, a resident of a small village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is married and has been blessed with two school-aged children. Saing works hard in the rice farming business to uplift the family’s standard of living to provide them a better life. With the help of her husband, Saing enjoys doing her daily activities a lot and she strives to make a good harvest from the rice field each year. Saing has been involved in this business for almost 21 years.

Siang requested credit from HKL to buy cashew nuts in bulk from local farmers. She hopes to make this a profitable business. With the increase in income, Saing wants to renovate her present house that is not very sturdy and comfortable to live in.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk from local farmers.

loans.name: 32-Buena Vista Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento 32 BUENA VISTA  esta  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco de emprendimiento es la Sra. Neitza tiene 46 años esta casada  tiene 5 hijos  que tres ya son independientes y dos todavía dependen de ella, ella se dedica a al venta de material de construcción ella vende viguetas en una tienda en la zona de Molle Molle,  la Sra. Neitza es cliente antigua de la institución ya que esta es la quinta secuencia de su crédito, la Sra. Neitza utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de viguetas  por mayor para su negocio y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Neitza enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, la Sra. Neitza es una persona muy trabajadora, se siente orgullosa y feliz por su trabajo y por apoyo que le brinda la institucion.
texts.en: The community bank "32 Buena Vista" is comprised of 8 people - 7 women and 1 man. The president of the bank is Neitza, who is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children, 3 of whom have left home and 2 of whom still live with her. She sells construction materials, particularly joists, in the Molle Molle area. Neitza has been with the institution a long time and this is her 15th loan cycle. Neitza will use the loan  to buy joists wholesale for her business and in this way will increase her working capital. Neitza faces challenges with her business including competition and she will use the benefits of this loan to improve her quality of life. Neitza is very hardworking and is proud and happy about her work and happy for the support she has received from the institution.

loans.use: to buy joists.

loans.name: Elsa Isolina

texts.es: Elsa Isolina de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia, ella posee una venta de piñatas en su residencia, tiene de diferentes estilos, al gusto de su clientela, princesas, muñecos de acción, caricaturas de moda, tradicionales, entre otros, desde hace un tiempo aumento la demanda de su producto pues están realizadas con material de primera calidad, elaboradas con dedicación y además a precios realmente accesibles; Elsa es una mujer dedicada a su labor, tiene muchos objetivos por alcanzar a futuro, piensa que el éxito en la vida de una persona está en prepararse para aprovechar la ocasión cuando se le presente, ella está preparada es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar papelería, alambre, pegamento y cartoncillo, etc a fin de elaborar las demás piñatas que demandan sus clientes y para las cuales no cuentan con recursos propios. Elsa Isolina tiene fe que así podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Elsa Isolina, 48 years old, lives with her children in her own house. She sells piñatas in her home. She has different styles, according to the tastes of her customers - princesses, action figures, popular cartoons, and traditional, among others. Some time ago demand for her products increased, since they are made with materials of the highest quality and with dedication, and at really accessible prices. Elsa is a woman dedicated to her work. She has many goals for the future. She thinks that success in a person's life lies in preparing oneself to take advantage of the opportunity when it appears, and she is prepared. This is why she is asking Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy paper products, wire, glue, paperboard, etc., in order to make the other piñatas that her customers ask for, and for which they do not have their own resources. Elsa Isolina has faith that in this way she will be able to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to purchase paper products and wire

loans.name: Konotie Yele Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Konotie Yele, sont toutes des femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font de la restauration, le commerce d’habillements et de parures, des poissons etc.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Konotie yele sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente MARIAM, deuxième personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter dix colis contenant chacun 20 calebasses avec les exploitantes de la commune de Massigui  et du village de Tona pour ensuite vendre  pendant les jours de foire au marché de Konobougou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de calebasses.
texts.en:
The women of the Konotie Yele group are all married. Their average age is 42 years old, and they have about three children each. They all live in large extended families in the village of Konobougou, in the Ségou region (fourth-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They were introduced to one another by relatives, neighbors, and friends. They sell prepared food, clothing, jewellery, fish, etc. The women of the Konotie Yele group are on their 16th group loan. 

Mariam, second from the right in the photo, plans to buy ten packages containing 20 calabashes each from farmers in the town of Massigui and the village of Tona. She will then sell the calabashes at the market in Konobougou to a clientele made up of both men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will be used to meet the needs of her family. Part of the profit will be reinvested in her calabash-selling business.

loans.use: to buy calabashes

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Roxana es de Condición muy Humilde, de estado Civil Casada, tiene dos hijos a quienes apoya moral y económicamente, trabaja como Trabajadora de Hogar más de 7 años en la misma casa, sus jefes le adoran y confían mucho en ella, su esposo trabaja como Albañil. Se les dio la oportunidad de poder comprar un Terreno en una Urbanización reciente de la  ciudad de Tarija , en la cual quieren construir, por ello solicitan el crédito en Cidre para poder de esa manera mejorar un poco más su condición de vida ya que la mayoría de esa Urbanización  ya terminaron de Construir sus casas , casi es la única casa de la Señora Roxana que esta con solo dos cuartos y ahí viven incómodos con sus dos hijos, por lo cual sería bueno que siga construyendo para que sus hijos estén cómodos y puedan realizar sus tareas de la mejor manera posible, pues así tendrán un espacio amplio donde puedan seguir estudiando y llegar a ser profesionales con el apoyo económico de sus padres.
texts.en: Roxana is a very humble person. She has a common-law husband and 2 children to whom she gives moral and economic support. She has worked as a domestic employee in the same house for more than 7 years. Her bosses adore her and put a lot of trust in her. Her husband is a mason. They had the opportunity to buy some land in a new development in the city of Tarija and they want to build a house there so they are requesting a loan from Cidre so that they can improve their quality of life. Most people in this development have already finished building their houses. Roxana's is almost the only house that only has two rooms and they are uncomfortable living there with their 2 children, so it will be good for them to continue the construction so that their children can be comfortable and do their homework in the best way possible. They will have plenty of space to study and become professionals with economic help from their parents.

loans.use: to build her home.

loans.name: Ri

texts.en:
Ri is 67 years old and a diligent mother of six children, living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She grows and sells vegetables to earn a living. She has her children help in managing this business as she becomes older. However, her spouse is the main income provider of the family. He travels by buffalo going through the commune and market with a trailer full of firewood to sell.

At the present, Ri is taking out a loan to buy cashew nuts in bulk in order to resell them for a profit. With her hard work and the help of this loan, Ri hopes that she will be able to attain success from her investment and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk in order to resell them for a profit.

loans.name: Lerng

texts.en:
Lerng, age 57, is a loving father of four children; three are married and the other one is single. He’s a widower who lives with his children in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Lerng is involved in the firewood-selling business to provide the income for the family.

He would like to sustain and improve his business but he has insufficient funds so he is asking for a loan to purchase stock of firewood for continuous sales. He has been a client of HKL for a few years. This will be his third loan, and he found that it’s very useful to make changes in his living status.

loans.use: to purchase stock of firewood for continuous sales.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean is a responsible mother who strives to provide a good standard of living for the family. She is 26 years old and has two school-aged children. She earns a living by doing farming, raising pigs, and selling Khmer cake in the commune. Kean would like to expand her farming business to increase her production and income to satisfy her family’s basic necessities in the coming years. She told us that the main important thing in her life is to provide a good education to her two children. For that reason, she has a commitment to work hard and continually support them, so that they can earn a degree and become professionals someday. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to purchase construction supplies and to pay for the construction fees. She hopes to see her house done soon, and it will be a comfortable one for the whole family. She is very happy for the given funds to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies and to pay for construction fees.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is a married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from one to three years. She describes herself to be determined and focused. She operates a grocery store where she sells kale, spinach, and onions. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a fast-growing area, and her primary customers are local residents of her village area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables . Maureen's dream and business goal is to own another grocery store within five years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia de cincuenta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, Ella posee una tienda en un chalet dentro del centro escolar de su localidad y en su residencia por las tardes una venta de pupusas, es muy conocida en la zona pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles, es una mujer con mucha fuerza interior para superar obstaculos, además el servicio es excelente; Rosa es una mujer con muchas metas por alcanzar siempre dispuesta a valorar cada oportunidad que se le presente, su labor es hacer crecer el negocio y mantenerlo adelante de la competencia,  por eso quiere mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda en la que posee su pupuseria a fin de tener una mejor imagen del negocio e higiene para la clientela, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material para colocar piso cerámico. Rosa Amelia tiene la determinación que éste es un importante cambio que servirá para mejorar el negocio y poder darle a su familia una vida mejor
texts.en: 59 year-old Rosa Amelia lives with her life partner and their children in their own home. She has a store in a house in the local school and, in the afternoons, she sells pupusas from her house. She is well known in the area as everything she sells is of a very good quality and she sells at affordable prices. She is a woman with a lot of internal strength for overcoming obstacles, and she gives her clients good service. Rosa is a woman who has a lot of goals that she wants to achieve and she always takes good advantage of opportunities that come her way. Her task is to grow her business and stay ahead of the competition. For this reason, she wants to improve her home where she has her store selling pupusas so that her business will have a better image and better hygiene for her customers. This is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to put down a ceramic tile floor. She is sure that this is an important change to better serve her customers and to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy ceramic floor tiles, cement, and glue.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es: Jaime Alberto de veintidós años de edad vive junto a su mama y su hermano en casa propia. Él se dedica a la confección de ropa de deporte, pans, licras, camisetas entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de más clientela pues todo lo que comercia es de excelente calidad, usa las mejores telas y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es único, en estas vacaciones Jaime quiere aprovechar la oportunidad para aumentar sus ventas, ya que muchas personas se dedicaran al deporte en estos días libres, él es un hombre capaz, responsable y con muy buenas ideas, piensa que solo la constancia y el amor al trabajo permitirán que llegue al éxito, quiere obtenerlo por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor. Jaime Alberto tiene la esperanza que así podrá mejorar la situación de vida en su hogar.
texts.en: Jaime Alberto, 22 years old, lives with his mother and his brother in their own house. He makes sportswear, pants, lycra shorts, and t-shirts, among other items. Lately he has had more customers because everything he sells is of excellent quality. He uses the best fabrics and he sells his items at really accessible prices. Also, the service is extraordinary. This vacation season, Jaime wants to take advantage of the opportunity to increase his sales, since many people play sports during these days off. He is a capable, responsible man with very good ideas. He thinks that only perseverance and love of the work will allow him to succeed. He wants to succeed, so that is why he decided to ask Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy wholesale fabric. Jaime Alberto hopes that in this way he will be able to improve the living situation in his home.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 2 children whose ages range from 5 years to 7 years. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a grocery store  where she sells fruit such as mangoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a busy and viable market  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more mangoes for selling. Her business goal is to own several such fruit-selling grocery stores within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more fruit.

loans.name: Adzovi

texts.fr: Adzovi est une femme âgée de 38ans. Elle a 02 enfants tous à l’école. Le premier a 17ans et le dernier 07ans. Elle est restauratrice depuis 2005 et exerce son activité dans un bar de la place. Elle est aidée par 02 personnes et s’approvisionne généralement au marché. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des ingrédients pour la restauration ( maïs, riz, tubercules d’ignames , tomates..). Elle  veut réinvestir dans l’activité, avoir un réfrigérateur pour mettre au frais les boissons des clients et assurer l’apprentissage de son fils ainé.
texts.en:
Adzovi is a 38-year-old woman. She has two children, both of whom attend school. Her eldest child is 17 years old, and her youngest child is 7.

She has been running a restaurant since 2005, located in a local bar. She has two people who help her, and she usually stocks up at the market.

She is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy ingredients for her restaurant (corn, rice, yam tubers, tomatoes..). She wants to reinvest in her business, have a refrigerator to keep her clients' drinks cool, and ensure the training of her eldest son.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, yams, and rice for her bar

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo, composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou,  Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce d’habillements de calebasses et de poisson.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente FAFA, deuxième personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter 40 complets d’habits pour enfants, 5 douzaines de pots pour boire, 20 seaux en plastique et les ingrédients pour la fabrication du parfums avec les fournisseurs de Bamako pour ensuite vendre à domicile, en ambulante et au marché de Konobougou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de d’habits et de parfums.
texts.en:
The members of the Siguidolo group, composed of married women and widows, average 37 years of age with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Konobougou, Segou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).
They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They cook food for sale and sell clothing,  gourds and fish. 

The members of the Siguidolo group are on their seventh solidarity loan.
Fafa, the second one from the right, plans to buy 40 outfits for children, five dozen mugs, 20 plastic pails and the ingredients for making perfume from the suppliers in Bamako in order to resell them later out of her home, as a street vendor and at the market of Konobougou, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly revenue of 50,000 West African francs, which will be used for family needs, with part of reinvested in her clothing and perfumes business.

loans.use: to buy various articles for resale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia, tiene 27 Años, vive en el trópico de Cochabamba en la localidad de entre ríos, es madre soltera, actualmente se dedica al comercio de fruta de temporada.
La señora  vino al trópico, de otra comunidad donde hay demasiada pobreza, buscando  mayor oportunidad de trabajo y un mejor nivel de vida para ella y para su pequeña hija, porque en su comunidad en los últimos tiempos afecto el desborde de los ríos y afecto a sus cultivos, apenas alcanzaba  para sobrevivir.
Cuando llegó indica, que se vino con unas cuantas ropas, en los primeros años que vino ayudaba a cargar fruta de temporada y llevaban a la ciudad de santa cruz, para su comercialización, aun  no podía encontrar un trabajo seguro, poco a poco fue aprendiendo el negocio del comercio de fruta, para posteriormente dedicarse a este rubro, trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su hijo y que no le falte nada en un futuro.
Con el transcurso del tiempo fue  ahorrando poco a poco y fue comprándose un lote urbano y se hizo una pequeña habitación donde actualmente vive, ahora  la  clienta solicita el crédito para capital de operación y con ello comprar más fruta, para seguir creciendo y de esa manera sobresalir de esta situación tan pobre que vive, y posteriormente quiere mejorar su vivienda, para lo cual necesita incrementar su ingresos, y  con el crédito podrá incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 27, lives in tropical Cochabamba in Entre Ríos.  She is a single mother, and she currently sells seasonal fruit.  She came to the tropics from another community where there was too much poverty.  She came looking for a greater opportunity to work and a better standard of living for herself and her young daughter. In the past seasons her community was affected by the rivers flooding, and it affected her crops.  She barely managed to survive.

She says that when she came she brought a few clothes.  In the first few years after she came she helped carry seasonal fruit and take it to the city of Santa Cruz to sell.  She still was not able to find secure work.

Little by little she was learning the business of selling fruit in order to later enter this field.  She works very hard to get her child ahead and so that her child will lack nothing in the future.

As time passed she was saving little by little.  She bought an urban lot, and she made a small room where she currently lives.

She is now requesting a loan for working capital.  She will use the loan to buy more fruit in order to continue growing.  This way she will overcome this very poor situation in which she lives.  Later she wants to improve her house.  To do so she needs to increase her income.  With the loan she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is a thirty-two year old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from four to six. He describes himself as intelligent. He has a motorcycle which he uses to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a densely populated area and along a tarmac road and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to run a stable transportation business.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman. She has seven children whose ages range from twenty-seven to thirty. She describes herself as aggressive. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are business people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a permanent room to run her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes. Ruth's dream and business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to buy one bale of skirts to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is a single mother of one child. Gladys is involved in the transport industry; a business she started from her savings. Besides this, Gladys also sells clothes.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends. Owing to the desire to obtain more income for her family needs, Gladys is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to start a grocery/vegetable shop. 

Her future ambition is to increase the number of motor cycles in the transport business and believes the additional income from both businesses will help her achieve her long term desire of building rental houses.

loans.use: To start a grocery/vegetable shop.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydiah is a single woman. She has 2 children whose ages range from 10 to 15 years. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail stall where she sells cereals such as beans, maize and black beans. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a busy and viable market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase cereals. Her business goal is to be a supplier of cereals in large quantities within 5 years.

loans.use: to add stock of cereals.

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia de sesenta y uno años de edad ya tiene casa propia, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad arroz, frijoles, huevo, pan, bebidas entre otros, es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos de muy buena calidad y los vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es único, siempre recibe a las personas con mucha alegría; María es una mujer muy trabajadora, enérgica y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante, piensa que el éxito no está en el dinero ni en la riqueza, si no en el alma, con este pensamiento se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, bebidas, etc. María Julia tiene confianza que de esta forma podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Julia is 60 years old, and she has her own house.  She has a store where she sells basic needs products like rice, beans, eggs, bread, and drinks, among others.  She is well known in the area, and she has gotten a lot of customers.

She always has what people need, her products are very good quality, and she sells her products for accessible prices.  Also, her service is unique.  She always greets people very cheerfully.

María is a very hard-working and energetic woman with a lot of enthusiasm for getting ahead.  She believes that success is not in the money or in the wealth; it is in the soul.  It is with this thought that she decided to request a loan from Integral.  

The loan will allow her to buy basic grains, bread, and drinks, etc.  María Julia is confident that this way she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, and drinks.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a 30-year-old single woman. She describes herself as a self-motivated woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services  such as blowdrying and plaiting. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located near an estate and bus station and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power from customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a dryer. Her business goal is to run another beauty salon within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have the biggest salon in her business area.

loans.use: to buy another dryer.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a 50-year-old married man. He has 5 children whose ages range from 2 to 6 years. He describes himself as a self-motivated man. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as a shortage of charcoal. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase twenty bags of charcoal. His business goal is to buy a motorcycle to aid in delivery of charcoal to customers within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be selling charcoal in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, sodas, stationery and bread. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a busy estate and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of room for the business operation. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy two bags of flour. Her business goal is to own another retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have more room for the business operation.

loans.use: to buy two bags of flour.

loans.name: Aïdote Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AÏDOTE est composé de treize personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Sophie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sophie est âgée de 28 ans. Sophie est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Paul. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sophie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Sophie vend de la farine de manioc, de l’arachide et de façon secondaire du pain à son domicile mais aussi par le système de distribution depuis quatre ans. Sophie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sophie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AÏDOTE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Aïdote group comprises thirteen people who live in the same area. This is the third time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ, in order to raise the level of their business. The group representative, named Sophie, is the woman whose hand is raised in the photo. Sophie is 28 years old. She is married to a driver named Paul. The couple have two children, both of whom are in their care and attend school. Sophie did not attend school. To provide for herself, for the past four years Sophie has sold manioc flour, peanuts, and sometimes bread as well, both at her home and through the distribution system. Sophie gets her supplies in a city in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her customers and increasing her sales volume and income, Sophie is seeking a third loan with ALIDÉ, along with the other members of the Aïdote group. The previous loans were repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy bags of manioc flour and cans of peanut oil.

loans.name: Yanira De Los Santos

texts.es: Yanira de los Santos de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su hija, ella posee una sala de belleza donde realiza todo tipo de peinados, maquillaje, lavados de cabello entre otros, siempre ha tenido mucha clientela pero últimamente ha aumentado aún más la demanda pues todo la que realiza es de excelente calidad, con los mejores productos y a precios bajos; Yanira es una mujer muy dedicada a su labor siempre dispuesta a aprovechar oportunidades que se le presenten para poder triunfar, piensa  que  el éxito está determinado por el hecho de tomar las cartas que te repartieron y utilizarlas con lo mejor de tu habilidad, quiere jugar sus cartas es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, tintes, herramienta de trabajo, entre otras cosas que aún no posee. Yanira tiene fe que este es un importante cambio para que su negocio mejores y aperturar opciones para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yanira de los Santos, age 39, lives with her daughter.  She has a beauty parlor where she does all types of hairstyles, make-up, and shampoos, among others.  She has always had a lot of customers, but lately the demand has increased even more.  

Everything that she does is of excellent quality and with the best products and low prices.  Yanira is a woman who is very devoted to her work.  She is always ready to take advantage of opportunities that present themselves in order to be able to triumph.

She thinks that success is determined by taking the cards you are dealt and using them to the best of your ability.  She wants to play her cards.  That is why she decided to request a loan from Integral.  A loan will allow her to buy creams, dyes, and work tools, among other things that she still does not have.

Yanira has faith that this is an important change so that her business improves and that options open so that her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, dyes, and work tools.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El señor Benito tiene 27 años de edad vive en Barrio Alto en el municipio de Villa Tunari de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el es casado y tiene 2 hijos, su esposa trabajo vendiendo refresco y el señor Benito  es  vendedor ambulante de ropa nueva.
Benito es joven y entusiasta muy deportista y su gran debilidad es que  confía en la gente con mucha facilidad, por lo que perdió un dinero que presto a unos conocidos quienes desaparecieron después de pedirle prestado sin dejar rastro y ninguna referencia,  lastimosamente el dinero que les dio como préstamo era para poder terminar de cancelar el saldo que debía el de su casita que había adquirido, por lo que se complico con la cancelación de su casa y tambien con su familia le proboco conflictos muy granves . Siendo que ahora el requiere de un préstamo para poder cancelar la deuda que esta pendiente de su casa, el seguirá trabajando y repondrá el dinero perdido con su esfuerzo y así demostrara que puede recobrar lo que perdió con mucho empeño y también, ahora vive con el escarrmiento y con la voluntad de enmendar su error, solo necesita un apoyo para no perder su casa.
texts.en:
Benito is 27 years old and lives in Barrio Alto in the town of Villa Tunari in the city of Cochabamba.  He’s married and has two children.  His wife works selling soft-drinks and Benito is a street peddler selling new clothes.

Benito is an enthusiastic young man, very sports oriented.  But his great downfall is that he trusts people very easily which is why he lost some money he lent to some acquaintances who vanished after asking him for the loan; they left no traces or references.  Sadly, the money he lent them was what he intended to use to pay off the loan he’d taken out to pay for his little house he’d gotten.  Therefore, paying off the loan got complicated and serious problems with his family arose too because of this.  

Seeing as how he needs a loan to pay off the pending house loan he will continue working and will replace the lost money with his effort thus showing that with much effort he can recover what he lost too.  He’s now learned his lesson and is willing to rectify his mistake; he just needs a little help in order not to lose his house.

loans.use: to pay off his home loan.

loans.name: Djodjina

texts.fr: Djodjina est une femme âgée de 55ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et ont ensemble 02enfants. L’ainé a 27ans et le dernier 18ans. Madame Djodjina est revendeuse de pagnes depuis 1993. Elle vend de façon ambulante et est à son cinquième prêt. Sa difficulté est la mévente. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des pagnes, avoir un stock important et assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants.
texts.en: Djodjine is a 55-year-old woman. She is married to a driver, and the couple have two children. The elder child is 27 years old and the younger is 18. Ms. Djodjina has been a retailer of pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African clothing) since 1993. She sells door-to-door and is on her fifth loan. Her main difficulty is a slump in sales. She is seeking this loan to buy and build up a significant stock of pagnes, and thus to ensure a bright future for her children.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African clothing)

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es: María Gloria de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee un tortillería en el lugar donde reside pero además se dedica también a la venta de chocobanano (guineo recubierto de chocolate refrigerado, es muy conocida en el lugar y últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela ya que todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad con tortillas calientitas entregadas en poco tiempo además el servicio es muy bueno; María es una mujer con muchos sueños para el futuro siempre está dispuesta a triunfar, piensa que las personas  no son recordadas por el número de veces que fracasan, sino por el número de veces que tienen éxito, y ella será recordada por sus triunfos, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, gas propano, bananos, chocolate, entre otros. María Gloria tiene la esperanza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Gloria is 44 years old and lives with her spouse and children in her own house.  She has a tortilla shop at home but she also sells “chocobanano” (frozen, chocolate-covered bananas).  She’s very well known in the area and has acquired a large clientele lately because everything she sells is good quality with nice and warm tortillas that are delivered quickly.  Besides, her service is very good.

María is a person with many dreams for the future who is always willing to succeed.  She feels that people are not remembered for the number of times they fail but for the number of times they succeed and she will be remembered for her successes.  

Because of this, she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy corn at wholesale, propane gas, bananas and chocolate, among others.  María Gloria hopes this way to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale, propane gas, bananas and chocolate, among others.

loans.name: Ibonne

texts.es: Ibonne desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para solventar tanto sus gastos como sus estudios, ella trabajaba en la empresa Baihiti como cajera pero tuvo que dejar este trabajo porque los horarios eran con cambios de turnos,  también le tocaba trabajar en turnos nocturnos y debido a que ella tiene una hija de 7 años, a quien no quiso descuidar, porque es una madre muy dedicada a la niña es que decide cambiar su actividad. Actualmente trabaja revendiendo productos de líneas de cosméticos. Ella ve que su negocio es bueno, sin embargo necesita capital de operación para la compra de cosméticos y así incrementar sus ventas. Con un maletín lleno de productos cosméticos y catálogos, es que ella todos los días realiza su actividad laboral, pese a que no tiene jefes ni horarios, ella se impuso sus horas de trabajo, y asimismo mientras su pequeña niña va al colegio, ella se esfuerza en ese horario para visitar la mayoría de sus clientes y poder realizar la venta de los productos. La principal motivación que ella tiene en su vida es la pequeña niña, Ibonne es madre soltera, y todo lo relacionado a su económica lo consigue por medio de su trabajo, lamentablemente no tiene familiares quienes la puedan colaborar con sus gastos, sin embargo ella dice que está acostumbrada, pues desde joven lucho por sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Ibonne had to start working at a very young age to cover her own expenses and to pay for her schooling.  She worked for Baihiti as a cashier but had to leave this job because the schedules had varying shifts and sometimes she got the night shift and because she has a 7 year old daughter she did not want to leave unattended because she’s a very dedicated mother to her little girl she decided she had to change her activity.

She currently works reselling cosmetics of various brands.  She notices that her business is good but she needs working capital to buy cosmetics to increase sales.  She heads out every day with a satchel full of her products.  Despite not having a boss or a set work schedule, she’s imposed working hours on herself and while her daughter is attending school she strives during that time to visit most of her customers to sell her wares.  

Her main motivation in life is her little girl.  Ibonne is a single mother and everything related to her economy she earns through her work.  Unfortunately, she does not have any relatives who can help her with expenses.  Nevertheless, she says she’s used to this since she’s striven toward her goals since she was young.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 58-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 28 years. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He operates a food stall where he sells chips. He has been involved in this business for 20 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located at a busy residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of potatoes. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase potatoes for making chips to sell. His business goal is to supply chips to schools. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big shop and venture into the business of supplying potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for making chips to sell.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme âgée de 36ans. Elle est mariée à un déclarant en douane et a 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. L’ainé a 10ans et le dernier 01an. Elle est revendeuse de bijoux (colliers, boucles d’oreilles) à toutes personnes de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne à Lomé depuis 2004 Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité, et avoir une place fixe pour vendre ses bijoux et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ablavi is a 36-year-old woman. She is married to a customs agent and has four children, three of whom are in school. The eldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 1. Ablavi has sold jewelry (necklaces, earrings) to all types of customers door-to-door since 2004. She gets her supplies in Lomé. She is seeking this first loan from WAGES to buy more merchandise. She wants to reinvest in her business, obtain a fixed location to sell her jewelry, and to ensure her children's education.

loans.use: To buy jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto de 56 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su hija la cual se ocupa de las tareas del hogar. El  se dedica a la reparación  y elaboración de calzado para todas las edades, gustos y preferencias. Es un hombre muy creativo y emprendedor. Para él lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con lo el trabajo y servicio que ofrece. Gracias a su dedicación en su trabajo ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas en la zona donde el habita lo cual ha permitido mantener su negocio activo.  El señor Jorge ha trabajado desde hace muchos años en esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia. Siempre trata de estar un paso delante de la competencia y de esta forma logra mantener a sus clientes los cuales  cada día le demandan más. Ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio por lo que solicita este credito a INTEGRAL para  comprar la materia prima necesaria como: cuero, pegamento, nylon, suelas, agujas, etc. para continuar elaborando los diferentes estilos de zapatos que frecuentemente le demandan sus clientes. No pierde la fe que de esta manera logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto, 56, lives in his own house with his daughter who does the housework.  He works repairing and manufacturing footwear for all ages, tastes and preferences.  He’s a very creative, enterprising man.  For him, what’s most important is that his customers are satisfied with the work and service he provides.  Thanks to his dedication at work he’s won over the trust of many people in the zone where he lives which has allowed him to maintain his business in operation.  Jorge has been working at this for many years so he has much experience.  He always tries to be one step ahead of the competition thus retaining his customers who are more demanding every day.

He’s decided to invest in his business which is why he needs this INTEGRAL loan to buy raw materials like: leather, glue, nylon, soles, needles, etc. to continue making different styles of shoes which have high customer demand.  He does not lose faith that he will manage to improve his and his family’s quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy leather, glue, nylon, soles, needles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastics, clothes materials, utensils,etc.

loans.name: Nyamai

texts.en:
Nyamai owns a grocery stall which has been in operation for nine years. She sells vegetables in this business and also runs a charcoal business. Nyamai is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She is the married mother of two school-going children, ages 20 and 17 years old. 

Nyamai is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of charcoal. The grocery business faces challenges related to supply during the dry seasons. This is the reason Nyamai complements her grocery sales with sales from the charcoal business. Extra income will help her pay for her children’s school fees. Her dream is to own a larger shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de 5, les membres de groupe Sabali vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, de tissus et pagnes, de gingembre, de riz et des assiettes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame  Wassa (deuxième femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est l’une des vendeuses de tissus et pagnes du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Madame Wassa compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge  certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The five members of the Sabali group mostly live in traditional households and are on average 32 years old with three children. They all live in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali) and know each other through familial, neighbourhood, and marital relations. The group members run small businesses selling fabric, pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African clothing), ginger, rice, and plates. With the goal of increasing their capital, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity (group) loan cycle.
