She started her job at the age of 32.  Her daughter helps her wait on the customers who visit her place, where they have a menu of different foods and beverages that they will have that day.  Her expectation is to improve the infrastructure of her business to have a better appearance.

She is getting the loan to supply her business by buying soda, juice, meat, bananas, chicken, and rice, as well as all the necessary supplies to support the business.

This loan will help her because she will be able to improve the presentation with the goal of improving customer service, because the season of better sales is coming to the community, during which she will be able to get better income.  In the future she hopes to expand the business as well as offer an ocean-touring service.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice, meat, bananas, chicken, and rice.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Poder, tiene 29 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa en las ferias, es madre de 2 niños, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 10 años, ella aprendió en Finca ha ser mas responsable y ser mas puntual, y con las ganancias que ha obtenido ha ido incrementando su negocio, y así darle mejor vida a sus hijos. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para la feria de Semana Santa
texts.en:
Paulina, 29, is a member of Poder Communal Bank.  She works selling clothing in the markets.  She is the mother of two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for ten years.  In FINCA she learned to be more responsible and more punctual.  With the profits she has made, she has been increasing her business and so giving her children a better life.

Now, she will invest the loan she is requesting in clothing for the Holy Week market.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to take advantage of the Holy Week season.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa es socia del Banco Comunal Poder, tiene 36 años, es madre de 3 hijos, y es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 2 años, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la selva. Ella se da cuenta que esta progresando y valora mucho la ayuda que Finca Perú le brinda por que le ayuda a poder salir adelante y educar a sus hijos, todos los préstamos lo invierte en su negocio y sabe que haciendo las cosas bien ella y su negocio crecerá. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite y leche para llevar a la Selva.
texts.en:
Elisa is a member of the "Poder" communal bank. She is 36, and the mother of three children. She has been a member of Finca Perú for two years. She has a grocery store in the tropical forest zone. 

She is aware that she is making progress, and greatly values the help that Finca Perú provides her, because it helps her to raise and educate her children. She invests all the loans in her business, and knows that by doing things well, she and her business will grow.  

Now with the loan she will purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil and milk to take to the tropical forest zone.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil and milk.

loans.name: Olaya Group

texts.fr: OLAYA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres exercent des activités dans la même localité. La représentante du groupe, Akpoton (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans. Akpoton est une veuve ayant cinq enfants dont trois sont à sa charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Akpoton vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les diverses charges de la maison. Akpoton n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Akpoton vend des produits divers  (pâtes alimentaires, riz, huile de palme, etc.) dans une ville du Benin depuis près de vingt ans. Akpoton s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Akpoton sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OLAYA. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
OLAYA is a group of three persons whose members have businesses in the same town. The group's representative, Akpoton (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 47 years old. She is a widow having five children, of whom three are in their care. Some of the children have had schooling. Akpoton lives alone with her children and cover the various household expenses by herself. 

Akpoton never attended school. To cope with her different expenses, she has been selling a variety of products (pastas, rice, palm oil, etc.) in a city in Benin for nearly twenty years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers, and with the aim of expanding her business, Akpoton, together with the other member of the group OLAYA, is requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé. This loan will be used by them to respond to the demands of their customers and to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy various items (rice, pasta, etc.)

loans.name: Mahuzonsou 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUZONSOU 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui s'approvisionnent sur le même lieu. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Philomène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Philomène est âgée de 49 ans et vit au Benin. Philomène est mariée à un certain Albert. Le couple a un enfant à charge qui n'est pas scolarisé. Philomène vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Philomène supporte ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Pour y parvenir, Philomène vend des glacières et des verres à boire de façon ambulante depuis près de sept ans. Philomène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Philomène désire satisfaire un plus grand nombre de clients par ses produits, mais Philomène ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de rehausser le niveau de son activité. C’est pour ce faire que Philomène sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUZONSOU 1. Les deux crédits reçus précédemment ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Mahuzonsou 1 Group is made up of three people who are all friends and buy their stock in the same place.  The representative of the group, Philomène, is 49 years old and lives in Benin.  Philomène is married to a man named Albert.  The couple takes care of one child, who does not attend school.  Philomène lives together with her husband and child.  Philomène and her husband share the responsibility of providing for the various needs of the family.

In order to accomplish this, Philomène has been itinerantly selling iceboxes and drinking glasses for almost seven years.  Philomène buys her stock at a market in Benin.  Philomène would like to be able to satisfy more clients with her products, however she does not have sufficient funds to allow her to raise her level of business.  This is why Philomène is asking for her third loan through ALIDé along with the other members of the Mahuzonsou 1 Group.  Their two previously received loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase iceboxes, drinking glasses, and dishes.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 30 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO 30 est formé de trois personnes qui exercent les mêmes activités génératrices de revenus et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Philomène, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Philomène est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Joackim. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Philomène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges. Philomène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Philomène exerce comme activité, la transformation de noix de palme et la vente de la farine de manioc dans une région au Benin. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Philomène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Philomène désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Philomène sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 30, un troisième crédit auprès de  ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Gbenonkpo 30 Group is made up of three people who earn their income in the same way and belong to the same tontine group.  The representative of the group, Philomène, is pictured here with her hand raised.  This is the third time that the group has asked for financial support through ALIDé with the goal of raising their level of business.

Philomène is 33 years old and married to a farmer named Joackim.  The couple has two children, both of whom are dependents and one is attending school.  The couple both provide for the family.  Philomène has not attended school.

For the past decade, Philomène has run a business processing palm nuts and selling cassava flour in a region of benin.  This has allowed her to respond to the needs of her family without any major difficulties.  Philomène stocks up at a market in Benin.

With the challenge of better responding to the demands of her clientele, Philomène, along with the other members of the Gbenonkpo 30 Group, is asking for a third loan via ALIDé.  The previously issued loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase palm nuts and cassava flour.

loans.name: Pong

texts.en:
Pong, 63, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been running their business which purchases junk materials for resale for over 10 years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Three of her children are employed in the garment factory. They earn about USD 8 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s income, Pong is requesting a loan of USD 800 to raise capital to purchase more junk materials for resale. By doing this, she would be able to make more profit to support her family. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a motorbike to carry junk materials to sell and to rebuild her current house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to raise capital to purchase more junk materials for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods such as lotions, rice, soap, sugar, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her sewing business by buying more machines.

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en:
Nyamaa, 39, has been selling all kinds of clothes in the bazaar non-stop since 2007. She lives with her husband and her daughter, aged seven, in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic yurt, which is in the suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She owns a rental stall in the bazaar and pays MNT 200.000 every month for the rental fee. 

Lately, her business earnings have been decreasing notably due to less sales volume. This badly influences her family's income. This year her daughter is going to begin at primary school. She will need more money to pay school fees and other related expenses. Now she needs to increase her inventory to expand her sales volume. The loan she is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing clothes from her supplier.

loans.use: To purchase clothes from her supplier.

loans.name: Erdenetuya

texts.en:
Erdenetuya, 28, has a business making and selling women's clothes. At her home, she makes and sews the outfits of women's clothing and her husband, Munkhbaatar, sells them to customers at the bazaar. She has been operating her business for 11 years. Initially she started her business with her mother: now she runs it with her husband. 

Erdenutaya lives with her husband, her daughter and two sons in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic yurt, which is in the suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Lately her business earnings have decreased notably due to less sales volume. This badly influences her family's income. Therefore, she needs to increase her inventory to expand her sales volume. The loan she is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing raw materials for more output.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for more output.

loans.name: Angin

texts.en:
Angin has been engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation for more than 18 years. On her farm, Angin breeds two cows, two calves and also, seven sheep. In addition, she grows potatoes and wheat on her own small plot of land. Angin sells the milk and meat produced to re-sellers and she sells the potatoes at the food market. Angin uses the wheat and some of the agricultural produce for her family’s needs.

Angin is 47 years old. She lives in Ddmashen village, Sevan area. She is married and has three children. Simultaneously with her agricultural business, Angin works as an accountant at the village outpatients' clinic. Her husband is now working in Russia; her younger son is serving in the Armenian army. Her daughter is a student. Angin’s elder son is helping his mother in the agricultural business and thus they provide for the family and pay for Angin’s daughter’s education.
 
Angin is asking for a $1,600 loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer ahead of the sowing season.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer ahead of the sowing season

loans.name: Hassina

texts.en:
Hassina is 35 years old and is married with four children aged between four and 16 years old. She also takes care of a child who is a relative. She sells milk and fertilizer and has been in this business for two years. Hassina currently employs one person to help her.

Hassina has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her breeding cows by buying more cows to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her breeding cows by buying more cows to sell.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур трудолюбивый и умный человек. Он  женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Три года назад он открыл магазин возле своего дома, где занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Он приобретает товар оптом, а затем продает в розницу. Также продает парфюмерии. С прибыли он купил холодильник  для хранения напитков. Баходур запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки продуктов питания с целью увлечения ассортимента продуктов.
texts.en: Bahodur is an intelligent and hardworking man who is married and raising two children.  Three years ago he opened a shop close to his home, where he buys and sells food products.  He buys his goods wholesale and resells for retail.  He also sells perfumes.  With the profits he bought a refrigerator to store drinks.  Bahodur is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni for the purchase of food products, in order to increase his selection of goods.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Les Hommes De Dieu Group

texts.fr:
Mr POUSSI est le représentant du groupe LES HOMMES DE DIEU. Il est marié et père de quatre(04) enfants. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 3 mois. Parmi ses enfants trois (03) vont à l’école. Il a six (06) personnes en charge.

	Mr POUSSI est vendeur de fils électrique depuis 20 ans.il s’approvisionne dans les grandes boutiques de Ouagadougou. Il vend ses fils sur place à Ouaga et en province.

	Mr POUSSI veut s’acheter 10 rouleaux de fils électrique.

	Mr utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne devenir un vendeur grossiste de fis électriques.
texts.en:
Poussi is the representative of the group called Les Hommes de Dieu [Men of God].  He is married and the father of four children, the eldest of whom is twelve years old and the youngest is three months.  Three of his children are attending school.  He has six dependents.

Poussi has been selling electrical wire for 20 years.  He buys his stock from the large shops in Ouagadougou.  He sells his wire right there in Ouaga as well as in the country.

Poussi would like to purchase 10 rolls of electrical wire.

Poussi reinvests his profits to strengthen his business.  He aspires to one day become an electrical wire wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase ten rolls of electrical wire.

loans.name: Gülşah

texts.en:
Gulsah is 21 years old and was born in Eskisehir. She is not married and lives with her family. Gulsah has two siblings and is the middle child.  Her father is a tradesman and her mother is a housewife.  Gulsah, when describing herself and her chosen profession, says "'because I love playing with women's hair, I chose this profession. I started playing with my dolls' hair as a child and it awakened my curiosity.  I love my job."  

She has worked hard in order to be competent in her profession at such a young age.  After working with (being apprenticed to) a hairdresser for seven years, she completed her training. After meeting with Maya, Gulsah was able to start on her dream of opening a hairstyling business.  She named it Kokoşı (the closest translation is Chic).  Her work and her shop are incredibly beautiful because she opened it completely through her own efforts and labor.

Gulsah has been a Maya client for five credit cycles and has used the loans to refresh and develop her shop.  She has literally given her shop some of her own beauty and charm.  This is her sixth credit cycle with Maya and her first through Kiva. She will use this loan to buy materials and pay for labor so she can add a waxing room. This waxing room will enable to her expand her services. This is one more step towards her future dream of developing her business into a full service beauty salon. Gulsah is such a bright and ambitious young woman: it is easy to believe that she will be able to realize her future dreams. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Volunteers

 Gülşah ,1991 Eskişehir doğumlu bekar 3 çocuklu bir ailenin ortaca çocuğu .  Babası esnaf  annesi ev hanımı .Gülşah , kendisini ve seçtiği mesleği anlatırken şöyle söylüyor ;kadınların saçlarıyla oynamayı sevdiğim için bu mesleği tercih ettim çocukken bebeklerimin saçlarıyla oynamaya başladım ve sonrasında bu bende bir merak uyandırdı işimi çok severek yapıyorum.  Genç yaşında mesleğinin ehli olabilmek için çok çalışmış 7 sene bir kuaförde çalıştıktan sonra bu işin eğitimini de almış sonrasında Maya ile tanışan Gülşah ,hayallerinin başlagıcı olan kuaför dükkanını açtı .Adı kokoşi .  Onun işi ve dükkanı inanılmaz güzel çünkü tamamen kendi emeğiyle kendi çabalarıyla açtı ve Maya’dan 5.kredisini kullanarak dükkanını dahada geliştirdi.  Son çektiği kredi ile dükkanının alt katınıda faliyete sokuyor.  Gelecek ile ilgili en büyük hayali bir güzellik salonu açabilmek.  O kadar pırıl pırıl ve azimli bir kız ki kesinlikle bu hayalini gerçekleştireceği kanısındayım.  Gülşah,adeta kendi güzelliğini ve şirinliğini dükkanına vermiş .

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor so she can add a waxing room

loans.name: Zidiwendtaore Group

texts.fr:
Mme EVELINE est la représentante du groupe ZIDIWENDTAORE. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre(04) enfants. Le plus âgé a 13 ans et le moins âgé a 3 ans. Parmi ses enfants trois (03) vont à l’école. Elle a six (06) personnes en charge.

	Mme est tisseuse  depuis 10 ans et vend parallèlement de la farine de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de pissy. Ses clients sont ses amis, voisins et autres.

	Mme veut s’acheter ½ rouleaux de fils  de tisse et 01 sac de farine.

	Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour investir, épargner et participer à la scolarisation des enfants. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et ouvrir une maison de vente de pâtisserie.
texts.en:
EVELINE is the representative of the ZIDIWENDTAORE group.  She is married and the mother of four children ranging in ages between 13 and 3.  Three of her children go to school.  She has six people in her care.

EVELINE has been a weaver for the past ten years.  She also sells maize flour.  She stocks up at the Pissy market.  She sells to friends, neighbors etc.  

EVELINE wants to buy 1/2 roll of weaving thread and one bag of flour.  She uses her profits to invest, to put some money into savings, and to pay part of her children's school fees.  Her ambition is to expand her activity and to open a pastry shop.

loans.use: to buy 1/2 roll of weaving thread and one bag of flour.

loans.name: Ndi

texts.en:
Ndi is married with five children and they live at Mbengwi road, in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. The death of her brother is the main challenge she has faced and she hates thinking about it.

Ndi joined GHAPE in the year 2005 and has taken out and successfully repaid her loans four times. With the new loan requested, she says that she will buy day-old chicks, feed and medication for the chicks, firewood and also piglets and feed for them. She is very positive that her business will succeed because she is well versed in management and also owing to the business's longevity. The community will benefit from the business activities as chicks will be supplied at low prices to be used for special occasions and also for household consumption. Also her neighbors will not have to go long distances in search of firewood since she will always be able to supply them regularly.

Ndi says that the profit from the loan will be used for her children's education, medication for the family and also to buy other basic necessities needed by the family. The GHAPE loan is preferable to her because the charge is very small with convenient loan installment repayments.

loans.use: to buy chicks, piglets, feed, medication and firewood.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatou est couturière depuis prés de 20 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Son activité consiste à  acheter des tissus, à confectionner des ensembles, des draps de lit  et à les revendre dans le marché.
Seulement pour cette fois ci, madame Fatou veut honorer un marché de confection de pochettes et de tirelires en tissu commandé par une ONG de la place. Elle dispose d’un peu d’argent et voudrait compléter avec le crédit qu’elle sollicite auprès de l’IMCEC.
Sa famille est prise en charge par son époux ; elle n’a donc pas de charges qui l’encombrent.
Elle a comme projet futurs, d’améliorer les conditions de vie de son foyer et de diversifier ses produits et services.
texts.en:
Fatou has been a seamstress for almost 20 years. She is married and has mothered a family. Her business consists of purchasing fabrics, crafting outfits and bed linens, and then reselling these items in the market.

For this time uniquely, Fatou would like to honor the order that has been commissioned by an NGO in the area of crafted money boxes and purses.  She is investing a some of her own money, and would like to use this loan she has requested via IMCEC to constitute the rest.

Her family is supported by her husband, and so Fatou does not have any binding responsibilities.

For future projects, Fatou hopes to improve the living conditions of her home and to diversify her products and services.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for sewing and resale.

loans.name: Hirarie

texts.en: Hirarie, aged 27, has two children both of whom go to school. She sells clothes in her business which she has been running for the past two years. She wants the loan so she can increase the amount of clothes she has to sell. With the profits she wants to reinvest in the same business. In the future, she would wish to have a better business. In the photo, Hirarie is holding her handbag and counting notes for her next cycle's capital.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 33 years old and is married with three children aged between three and nine years old. He sells timber. 

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his timber business, by buying more trees to make timber to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more trees to make timber to sell.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusufu is 29 years old and is married with one child who is four years old. He sells various goods such as soap, lotions, cooking oil, umbrellas, biscuits, etc. 

Yusufu has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as soap, lotions, cooking oil, umbrellas, biscuits, etc. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as soap, lotions, cooking oil, umbrellas, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 35 years old and is married with three children aged between two and nine years old. He owns an electronics repair business and has had two years of experience in this business. 

Jean Bosco has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his electronics repair business by buying new materials to repair radios, TVs and telephones. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to expand his electronics repair business by buying new materials to repair radios, TVs and telephones.

loans.name: Godeline

texts.en: Godeline is 38 years old. She has one child who is two years old. She has been selling cassava flour for the past four years. With the loan she wants to buy more cassava flour to sell. With the profits she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un hombre de 23 años de edad,no tiene carga familiar. Vive en casa familiar,la cual está ubicada en CP Salitral, en el distrito de Motupe. Juan Carlos vive en la parte rural de este distrito, pero cuenta con servicios básicos de agua y luz eléctrica en su domicilio.
La actividad que desarrolla Juan Carlos es la cría y comercio de chanchos.Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de su padre, por lo que cuenta con bastante experiencia y conoce muy bien el rubro. Cuentan con clientes  ya establecidos en la zona, por su calidad y esfuerzo en lo que hacen.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es de 2000 nuevos soles, y serán para la compra de más chanchos para su ventao, para que de esa manera pueda tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona ya que Juan Carlos cuenta con clientela ya establecida.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a 23-year-old man who doesn't have his own family. He lives in a family home which is located in CP Salitral in the district of Motupe. He lives in the rural part of the district but has basic services like water and electric light in his home.

Juan Carlos raises and sells pigs for a living. He's been doing this in his home for 5 years now and learned this trade from his father because of which he has a lot of experience and knows the area well. They have an established clientele in the area because of the quality of and effort in what they do.

The total of the requested loan is 2000 nuevos soles and they will be used to buy more pigs to sell. In this way he will be able to have a greater income for his home and thus improve his quality of life. In this area there is no greater competition since Juan Carlos has an established clientele.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is married and, with her husband, has three children aged between 22 and 11, all of whom go to school. She has been running a business selling goats for one year. With the loan she plans to buy more goats to sell. Patricie plans to use the profits to expand her business. In the photo, Patricie is standing in the carpark of UOB.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Rodrigo Arcesio

texts.es:
Rodrigo Arcesio tiene 28 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en Quito Provincia del pichincha.

Rodrigo trabaja en el Hotel 9 de octubre cómo camarero. Solicita el crédito para poder realizar el pago de la matricula en la Universidad y poder comprar ropa.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá matricularse y poder estudiar.  

El pago de la Matrícula lo hará en Quito.

El sueño es poder tener un negocio propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es terminar la carrera universitaria.

En el tiempo libre le gusta leer, escuchar música y estar en el Internet.
texts.en:
Rodrigo Arcesio is 28 years old, single, and doesn't have any children. He lives with his mother in Quito in the province of Pichincha.

Rodrigo works at Hotel 9 de Octubre as a waiter. He is requesting the loan to be able to make the payment to enroll in college and to buy clothing.

With the help of this loan he will be able to enroll and study.

He will make the payment for enrollment in Quito.

His dream is to have his own business. He is faced with the challenge of completing his university degree.

In his free time he likes to read, listen to music, and surf the Internet.

loans.use: to be able to make the payment to enroll in college and to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase various goods such as sugar, soap, salt and plastic shoes to sell.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is twenty-five years old. She has one child aged eight months. Her husband works as a driver. She sells different types of fabrics which she has been doing for six years. She wants the loan to add more fabrics to the stock in her store. With the profits, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Choijinhorloo

texts.en:
Choijinhorloo is a forty-six-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in a suburban area of the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is employed and their daughters are in college and high school. He has been making wooden products since 1992. He has an experience of twenty years in the field. His workplace is in his home, outside the yard. The products he supplies include table, chair, sofa and other types of furniture. 

Choijinhorloo is a hardworking and talented carpenter who says that "I would like to improve the business activity by purchasing the necessary materials like wood, nails and applicators in large quantities, so that I can produce more products at once to expand the volume". The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to purchase wood, nails and other materials for the business.

loans.use: To purchase wood, nails and other materials.

loans.name: Yessenia Vanessa

texts.es:
YESSENIA VANESSA tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Quito Provincia del Pichincha.

YESSENIA VANESSA se dedica a estudiar Administración de Empresas. Solicita el crédito para comprar ropa de niños cómo calentadores, camisetas, medias, chompas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá dar inicio del nuevo negocio que va a ponerse.

 Las compras de la mercadería lo hará en Quito. El sueño es poder aplicar el negocio y tener cobertura en otras ciudades.

El desafío al que se enfrenta es terminar la carrera universitaria y seguir adelante con el negocio.
texts.en:
YESSENIA VANESSA is 22 years old, single and has no children.  She lives with her parents in Quito, in the province of Pichincha.

YESSENIA VANESSA studies Business Administration and she is requesting a loan to buy children's clothing such as sweatshirts, t-shirts, socks and sweaters.  With the help of the loan she will be able to start up the new business she is planning.

Her merchandise purchases will be made in Quito and her goal is to extend her business to other cities.

The challenge she is facing is to finish her university degree while going ahead with her business plan.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing such as sweatshirts, t-shirts, socks and sweaters.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura es socia de Banco Comunal Bienestar II, tiene 62 años, es dueña de un puesto de abarrotes, es madre de 6 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace más de 10 años, es casada, gracias Finca logró educar a sus hijos y mejoró en su negocio, ahora la relación con su familia es buena gracias a las capacitaciones que le brindan en su bancomunal. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevo, etc.
texts.en: Maura is a member of the communal bank BIENESTAR II.  She is 62 years old, married, has six children, and owns a grocery store.  For over ten years she has been a member of FINCA Perú, thanks to which she was able to educate her children and improve her business.  The relationship with her family is good thanks to the training she has received from the communal bank.  She plans to use the loan to buy goods such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, etc.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Enhmanlai

texts.en:
Enhmanlai is a twenty-four-year-old man who lives with his parents and brother in the capital city of Mongolia. He started a printing business two years ago. The business has been successful because there was a big demand for it. Instead going to the center of the city, the local people now come to his business. He has been meeting the needs of customers and it has been appreciated. He started at first with some old equipment and now he is planning to replace the ones that have been used for a long time. 

Enhmanlai is a bright young man who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the latest equipment for my business, so that I can provide the best service to the customers and increase my income". The total amount he is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT to buy necessary equipment for the printing shop.

loans.use: To buy necessary equipment for the printing shop.

loans.name: Dulam

texts.en:
Dulam is a thirty-two-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in a suburban area of the capital city of Mongolia. Two of her children go to secondary schools and the youngest one stays at home. She has been running a meat retail business since 2003 with her husband. She goes to the countryside where she purchases the supplies from the herders. She trades meat at the local trading center. This has been the only income source for her and her family. 

Dulam is a bright woman who says that "I would like to improve the business activity by purchasing meat wholesale all at once, so that I can save on transportation expenses and save for my children's future. I wish to improve the livelihood of my household". The total amount she is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT to buy more meat from the herder families.

loans.use: To buy more meat from the herders.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina es socia de Banco Comunal Bienestar, tiene 65 años, su negocio es una tienda de artesanías, es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 5 años, es madre de 5 hijos, es soltera, estando en Finca mejoró en su negocio y pudo educar a sus hijos, Mercelina se dedica también a otras actividades así obtiene mas ingresos, ahora vende comida y carne. Gracias a sus ahorros pudo mejorar su casa. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos al por mayor para la venta de comidas las que ofrecerá en la ferias durante la semana santa.
texts.en: Marcelina is a member of the communal bank BIENSTAR.  She is 65 years old and has a craft store.  For over five years she has been a member of FINCA Perú.  She is single and has five children.  Being part of Finca has helped her improve her business and educate her children.  Marcelina also earns a living through other activies and is now selling food and meat.  Thanks to her savings she was able to renovate her house.  She plans to use the loan to buy wholesale products for the food she sells at the fairs during Holy Week.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, meat, and rice wholesale.

loans.name: Julia Alicia

texts.es: Alicia es socia de Banco Comunal Bienestar, tiene 64 años, es madre de 9 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú por mas de 10 años, es viuda, se dedica a la venta de cochinilla y tara, gracias a sus ahorros logró construir su casa, y compró muebles para su hogar, también le gusta las capacitaciones que recibe en las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque le enseñan a ahorrar, a como llevar su negocio y a distribuir sus ganancias, cosa que no lo hacen en otros lugares. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de tara y cochinilla.
texts.en: Alicia is a member of the communal bank BIENESTAR.  She is 64 years old and has nine children.  For over ten years she has been a member of FINCA Perú, and she sells ecological dyes, "cochinilla" and "tara", for a living.  Thanks to her savings she was able to build a house and buy furniture.  She enjoys the training she receives at the communal bank meetings because she learns how to save money, run a business and distribute her earnings, which is something she cannot learn elsewhere.  She plans to use the loan to buy "tara" and "cochinilla".

loans.use: To buy "tara" and "cochinilla" (ecological dyes)

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es: Nolberta es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar, tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, es casada y socia de Finca Perú desde hace más de 10 años, se dedica a la venta de cereales que lleva a la selva (VRAE), gracias a Finca se compró su molino y una ventiladora para moler y ventear los cereales, en las reuniones de su Banco Comunal aprendió a mejorar en su negocio y en su hogar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en compra de cereales para moler y venderlo.
texts.en: Nolberta is a member of the communal bank BIENESTAR.  She is 55 years old, married and has three children.  For over ten years she has been a member of Finca Perú.  She sells cereals in the VRAE (Valle del Río Apurímac y Ene) valley forest.  Thanks to Finca she has bought a cereal grinder and dryer.  In the communal bank meetings she has learned to improve her business and household.  She plans to use the loan to buy cereals to grind and sell.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, es casada y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 7 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene un carro de transporte pasajeros. Estando en Finca y gracias a los préstamos recibidos y a sus ahorros compró su casa. Le gusta las reuniones por las capacitaciones que recibe para su mejor desempeño en el negocio y para mejorar las relaciones con su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo destinará en la compra de repuestos para su vehículo.
texts.en: Mercedes is a member of the 'Bienestar' community bank.  She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has been a member of Finca Peru for 7 years.  Her business is selling clothing and she also has a car for transporting passengers.  Being a member of Finca, and thanks to the loans that she has received and her savings, she was able to buy her house.  She enjoys the meetings because of the training that they receive as it helps her to better run her business and improve her relationships with her family.  She will use the loan that she has requested to buy spare parts for her vehicle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es: Rosa Matilde es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en crédito anterior ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación. Esta emprendedora ha invertido en su negocio en la compra de más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes en el bazar. Actualmente Solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio comprara  hilos, cintas, zipper, botones, pegamentos  entre otros materiales.
texts.en: Rosa Matilde is an existing client of Fundación León 2000.  Throughout her last loan, she showed herself to be a responsible person who has a desire to do well in life.  This entrepreneur has invested in her business, buying more products to offer the customers who come to her store.  She is requesting this loan to invest in her business, purchasing threads, ribbons, zippers, buttons, adhesives and other materials.

loans.use: to buy threads, ribbons, zippers, buttons, adhesives, etc.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora Nora es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 56 años de edad. Ella tiene una abarrotería desde  hace 14 años este negocio lo inicio con la venta de chiverías meneítos, churritos, tortillitas etc. 
El crédito lo invertirá en el negocio con la compra de granos básicos, café, sal, etc.
texts.en:
Nora is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She is 56 years old.  Nora has had a grocery store for 14 years.  She started her business selling  Meneítos (cheese puffs), Churritos (a brand of snack), 'tortillitas' (fritters), etc.

Nora will invest her loan in her business, buying basic grains, coffee, salt, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, coffee, salt, etc.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: Marianela es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, es conviviente, es socia de Finca Perú hace más de 7 años, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, estando en Finca Perú y gracias a los préstamos y ahorros ha podido comprar su casa, tiene un hogar respetuoso, gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe aprendió sobre al importancia de la puntualidad y la responsabilidad, no solo vende en la ciudad sus productos si no también esta abasteciendo en otros lugares como la selva. El préstamo que solicita lo destinara en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche y otros para su venta.
texts.en: Marianela is a member of the 'Bienestar' community bank.  She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She has been a member of Finca Peru for more than seven years.  Marianela's business is selling groceries.  Being a member of Finca Peru, thanks to the loans and the savings, she has been able to buy her own home.  She now has a decent home.  Thanks to the training sessions that she has attended, she has learned the importance of punctuality and responsibility.  Marianela does not only sell her products in the city but also supplies other places such as communities in the jungle.  She has requested this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and other products to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and milk with which to stock her business

loans.name: Luz Y Amor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz y Amor lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la seña Jenny Vanessa quien vende ropa desde hace varios años  e invertirá en mercadería en especial veraniega por la temporada de semana santa. 
Las otras integrantes son Norma quien vende ropa y perfume y Silvia Rosa quien vende nacatamales, frito y leña desde hace mas de 10 años.
texts.en:
The 'Luz y Amor' (Light and Love) community bank is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is Jenny Vanessa, who has been selling clothing for several years.  She will invest her loan in buying merchandise, especially summer clothing for the Holy Week season. 

The other members of this group are Norma, who sells clothing and perfume, and Silvia Rosa who has been selling tamales, fried food and firewood for more than ten years.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is a forty-one-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in a suburban area of the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is employed. The children go to college and high-school. She started a construction-materials trading business in 2004. She trades products at the bazaar, which is often crowded and has many customers. She rents a counter at a bazaar, but she is planning to develop the business by buying her own shop counter. 

Oyunchimeg is an honest and bright woman who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by buying construction materials in large amounts from China so that I can save more money and save it for my daughters' college tuition fees". The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy construction materials to sell.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to sell.

loans.name: Bundhorol

texts.en:
Bundhorol is a thirty-two-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Uvurhangai province of Central Mongolia. Her husband is employed and the oldest child studies at a secondary school. She started running a public catering business in 2004. The business is located near a road that tourists often travel along. She built a winter house so that she could also run the business in wintertime. Now she plans to expand the building into a food store. She has realized that that the location where she runs her business is quite well-located and has lots of domestic and foreign customers traveling through it. 

Bundhorol is an active woman who says that "I would like to expand my business activity by extending the building so I can open a food store, allowing me to develop my business and increase my income". The total amount she is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more construction materials to continue to build her food store.

loans.use: To purchase more construction materials to continue building her food store.

loans.name: Thay

texts.en:
Thay is forty-three years old. She is an industrious mother who raises hogs and fattens them for sale. She has been doing this for five years. She has two single children and two married children. Presently her single daughters work as garment workers in various workplaces. They help the family by sending part of their salary home every month. 

Thay would like to renovate her house and cover the roof with tiles. So she needs additional capital to pay construction fees so she can achieve her dream of building a good shelter. She hopes that she can expand her hog raising business and improve her living one day.

loans.use: to renovate her house and cover the roof with tiles.

loans.name: Kam

texts.en:
Kam, sixty, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband runs a business selling knives and axes and earns about USD 5 per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD 6 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economic situation, Kam is requesting a loan of USD 600 to provide capital for her business and allow her to purchase more groceries to sell. This purchase would enable her to make more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the additional profit to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum, forty-two, is married with five single children. She lives with her family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province, where she was born and grew up on a family farm. She is involved in a pig-raising business. She fattens her pigs for both slaughter and for breeding. She has been in this business for eight years. 

Sum’s family doesn’t yet own any vehicle for traveling. For that reason, Sum is asking for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for the entire family’s use. It’ll provide a good means of transport for her family, allowing them to go anywhere they wish, without paying for a taxi service as in the past.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for the entire family’s use.

loans.name: Nhak

texts.en:
Nhak is forty-five, married, and has four children. Together, they live happily in a small village of Baray district, where the common business is agriculture. Due to the very high cost of living, Nhak decided to engage in a hog-raising business to help her husband, who sells firewood in order to make an income to satisfy the family's basic needs. She has been in this type of business for almost eight years and normally generates an average of 1.50 USD per day.

Nhak hopes to achieve a better quality of life through the requested loan and her own efforts. So she has applied for a loan to purchase a good motorcycle for personal and business purposes. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and find better ways of building a comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase a good motorcycle for personal and business purposes.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Ky, forty-three, is a farmer living in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. Ky started working in rice farming once she became an adult and was living with her parents. It is a family-owned business and was handed down from one generation to another. She is hardworking and works honestly in performing her daily tasks in the rice field. Her spouse always works with her to achieve their goal.

Due to inadequate capital, Ky is seeking a loan through HKL to partially repair her house, especially the broken parts that need to be fixed soon. She is very happy to receive the funds to renovate her house. She hopes through this loan to have a comfortable shelter, which is satisfactory for the family.

loans.use: to partially repair her house.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam is sixty-two years old, a resident of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. She owns and manages a rice farming business, from which the family generates its main income and meets its daily needs. She has worked in this business for more than thirty years. She has a life partner who is in the same business and has two married children and one single child who presently lives with her under the same roof.

Due to insufficient funds to cover her cultivation expenses, Lam is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to pay for plowing and land cultivation. Lam believes that she will be able to make her business more successful through this loan from our kind lenders.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and land cultivation.

loans.name: Kâng

texts.en:
Kâng is a forty-eight-year-old married woman who resides in Prey Chor district. She has been blessed with four children. They are all single but one is engaged and will be married in the coming months. Kâng raises her family with the income generated from her rice farming business. She has been in this business for ages. She is thankful that her business can provide her family with a decent standard of living. 

Kâng would like to take her first loan from HKL to supplement the capital she has to prepare her child's wedding party. She is very happy and appreciative of being able to borrow the funds.

loans.use: to supplement the capital she has for the preparation of her child's wedding party.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Chan, is engaged in a fish-selling business to generate income for the family. She sells in a local market, where there are many customers who prefer to buy her fish because of her honesty and friendliness. She typically earns approximately 3.00 USD per day through this business.

To improve her living standards, Chan is asking for a loan of 1,100 USD to hire a plantation to grow crops. She hopes that she will be able to make her business profitable through the great help from our lenders.

loans.use: to hire a plantation to grow crops.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is forty-seven years old, a loving mother who lives in Dongkor commune. She takes care of her children and manages all household things, while her husband works on a construction site to provide their daily income. Son has two single children and one married child, all of whom are employed and have independent incomes.

With the requested funds, Son will buy a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family. Son told us that this loan will help her to reduce her transportation expenses. She hopes that this will help to improve her situation.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to provide transportation for the family.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is fifty-eight years old and has five children. Dominga is married and three of her children are in school.

Dominga is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Dominga requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Dominga has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed seventeen times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dominga would like to save enough money to have a rice mill.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sary Vuth

texts.en:
Sary Vuth, twenty-six, is widower, resides with his mother and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been running a business repairing televisions for over seven years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her mother runs grocery store and earns about USD 3 per day. 

Sary Vuth is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more tools to use in his television-repair business. This purchase would enable him to have enough tools for his reparation. 

In the future, he would like to rebuild his workshop to make it bigger and purchase a new house to live separately from his mother.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to use in his television-repair business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is sixty-four years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising hogs for fourteen years and also earns additional income from coconut and pandan weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elfa

texts.en:
Elfa works hard to support her family. Elfa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elfa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, detergents and other groceries.

Elfa has been in this business for eleven years.

In the future, Elfa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, detergents and other groceries.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, thirty-two, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in purchasing and weaving plastic bag to resell for over seven years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Chenda is requesting a loan of USD 500 to raise capital so that she can purchase more plastic bags to resell. This purchase would enable her to make more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bags to resell.

loans.name: Freda

texts.en:
Freda is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Freda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Freda has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Las Puntuales Group

texts.es:
El grupo las puntuales lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Joselyn de 23 años de edad quien se  dedica al comercio de ropa. Este negocio lo inicio hace 3 años con los pedidos de los clientes y poco a poco realizó su clientela actualmente invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería.
 Ella es casada y tiene un bebe de 4 meses y su meta es construir su casa.
Las otras integrantes son Karen de 23 años quien vende cosméticos, María Mercedes quien vende ropa desde hace 8 años y Alejandra quien vende cosméticos desde hace 5 años.
texts.en: The Las Puntuales group is made up of four hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Joselyn, who is 23 years old. She sells clothing. She started this business 3 years ago with orders from customers and little by little she established her clientele. Right now, she will invest the loan in buying merchandise. She is married and has a 4 month old baby. Her goal is to build her house. The other members are Karen, who is 23 years old and sells cosmetics, Maria Mercedes, who has sold clothes for 8 years, and Alejandra, who has sold cosmetics for 5 years.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise, mainly summer clothing for the season.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es una mujer muy honrada y trabajadora que siempre ha buscado la manera de salir adelante y progresar continuamente, es por ese motivo que poco a poco se ha convertido en una microempresaria y para ello se dedica a tres tipos de pequeños negocios.

Ella empezó criando y vendiendo unos pocos cerdos, ya que sus vecinos se dedicaban a la misma actividad y ella sabía que este negocio iba a brindarle unos cuantos ingresos, cuando logró juntar un poco de dinero compró una trimoto, la cual actualmente da en alquiler algunos días de la semana. Y como un negocio especial, se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y refrescos, lo que le ha permitido generar unos ingresos extras.

Gracias al apoyo que se le está brindado, Celia podrá realizar el mejoramiento de los corrales de sus cerdos y también podrá realizar el mantenimiento que necesita su moto carga, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando como microempresaria y así tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus ingresos para cumplir su gran sueño “Comprar un terreno y terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Celia is a very honorable and hardworking woman who has always sought a way to get ahead and continuously progress. That is the reason that she has become a micro-business woman, and she has three types of small businesses. 

She started raising and selling a few pigs, since her neighbors were doing the same activity and she knew this business would bring her some income. When she was able to get a little bit of money together, she bought a three wheeled motorcycle which she rents out a few days a week. As a special business, she sells soft drinks and snacks, which has allowed her to make some extra income. 

Thanks to the support she is receiving, Celia will be able to improve the pig pens and also do some maintenance on her motorcycle. This will allow her to keep working as a micro-business woman and thus have the opportunity to increase her income to realize her dream: buy a plot of land and finish building her house.

loans.use: to improve her pig pens and do maintenance on her three wheeled motor cycle.

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es:
Rosa Delia, tiene 28 años de edad, casada desde hace 13 años, vive en una aldea de Morazán, Yoro con su familia y sus dos hijos de 9 y 11 años de edad.

Rosa Delia, hace 3 años que se dedica a vender mercadería como cosméticos, cremas, aretes, pulseras, collares, champú, adornos de casa y utensilios de cocina. Este negocio lo comenzó con dinero propio y ahora está solicitando un préstamo a ODEF de 10,000 Lempiras para surtir de mas productos de cosméticos accesorios para damas, utensilios de cocina y otros, con esta inversión va incrementar las ventas.
Su meta es llegar a tener un negocio grande para obtener ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su casa y las condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Rosa Delia, age 28, has been married for 13 years.  She lives in the village of Morazán, Yoro.  She lives with her family and her two children, ages 9 and 11.

For three years Rosa Delia has been selling merchandise like cosmetics, creams, earrings, bracelets, shampoo, household adornments, and kitchen utensils.  She started this business with her own money.

She is now requesting a loan from ODEF for 10,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to stock more products like cosmetics, women’s accessories, kitchen utensils, and others.  With this investment her sales will grow.

Her goal is to come to have a large business in order to get income that will help her improve her house and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: cosmetics, creams, earrings, bracelets, shampoo, household adornments, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las palomitas lo conforman cinco personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras  la coordinadora del grupo es la señora Maritza de 41 años quien tiene una fritanga desde hace 17 años la cual inicio con unos ahorros y poco apoco fue aumentándole. Ella invertirá el crédito en aceite, leña, maíz, plátano que comprar por mayor. Ella tiene tres hijos de 24, 22 y de 8 años.
Los otros integrantes son Ana de 35 años quien vende productos lácteos, Maryori quien tiene una fritanga desde hace 4 años, Olfa vende enchilada y platanitos y Francisco tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The Las Palomitas (The Little Doves) group has five hard-working and enterprising members. The group’s coordinator is 41 year old Maritza. She has had a fried food business for 17 years. She started it with some savings and little by little, it has expanded. She will invest the loan in the purchase of wholesale oil, firewood, corn and plantains. She has three children who are 24, 22 and eight years old. 
The other members include 35 year old Ana who sells dairy products. Member Marjorie has had a fried food store for four years. Member Olfa sells enchiladas and plantains and Member Francisco has a grocery store.

loans.use: purchase wholesale oil, firewood, corn, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Liset Mirian

texts.es:
Liset es un ejemplo de mujer microempresaria que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, en una bodega que ha logrado colocar en la sala de su casa, es gracias a esta iniciativa propia que empezó a poder reunir el dinero necesario para su pequeño de 2 años, el cual depende de ella y de su esposo, el cual es cobrador en servicio de transporte público.

Con mucho esfuerzo, Liset ha logrado incrementar la cantidad de sus productos, lo que la ha llevado a tener ingresos diarios, como gran apoyo a lo que viene logrando, tiene a su esposo, quien junto a su bebe, la motivan diariamente a salir adelante.

Liset desea poder superarse como microempresario y persona, es por eso que desea poder comprar nuevos productos (Leche, Atún, Café, Frejoles, etc.) y 2 andamios, lo que le permitirá surtir sus productos y también mostrarlos, de este modo podrá asegurar sus ventas y así incrementar sus ganancias. 

Ella está muy convencida de que logrará grandes cosas y es por ello que desea empezar a vender en algunos meses un producto nuevo, como lo son los Posters, de esta manera generará mayores ingresos, que junto a los de su esposo construirán por fin su gran sueño “Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Liset is an example of a micro-business woman who sells groceries in a small store she has set up in the living room of her house. Thanks to this self initiative, she started to get the money together to help her 2 year old son, who depends on her and her husband. Her husband collects fares for a public transport service.

With much effort, Liset has been able to increase the quantity of her products and has been able to have daily income. Her husband, together with her baby, motivate her to get ahead.

Liset wants to get ahead as a micro-business woman and as a person. That is why she wants to buy new products (milk, tuna, coffee, beans, etc.) and 2 display shelves, which will allow her to stock her products and display them. In this way, she will be able to ensure her sales and increase her earnings. 

She  is very convinced that she will achieve great things and that is why she wants to sell a new product, posters, in a few months. In this way she will generate more income and with her husband finally achieve their dream, owning their own home.

loans.use: to buy products (milk, tuna, coffee, beans, etc.) and 2 display shelves for her store.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Roberto y su esposo, son padres de familia y tiene dos hijos uno de edad escolar y otro de apenas un años de edad. 
Están solicitando un préstamo para terminar  un cuarto, y no tienen el dinero necesario para comprar el material que es cemento, varilla, block, arena, ya que Don Roberto se encargara de terminar la construcción en horarios adicional a su empleo. 
El señor Roberto trabaja en una fabrica desde hace ya mas de 20 años como supervisor de materiales, y su esposo solo los fines de semana trabajo en limpieza de una casa, con estos dos ingresos solventa los gastos familiares y con el cual pagaran el préstamo. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan su propio espacio en la casa y mejorar el patrimonio.
texts.en: Roberto and his wife are parents and have two children, one who is school age and another who is almost one year old. They are requesting a loan to finish a room and they do not have the money necessary to buy the material, which is cement, rod, block, and sand since Roberto will be in charge of finishing the construction outside of his work schedule. Roberto has worked  in a factory for more than 20 years as a materials supervisor and his wife works only on weekends cleaning houses. With that income they pay the bills and will pay the loan. They wish their children to have their own space in the house and to improve their legacy.

loans.use: to finish a room in the back of the house.

loans.name: Alis Cecilia

texts.es:
Alis Cecilia tiene 43 años de edad, es casada  y tiene 6 hijos de 19, 16, 14, 11, 9 y 10 años vive en una Colonia de San Pedro Sula. 
Doña Alis  tiene un negocio de venta de calzado específicamente tenis para caballeros y niños. Inicio este negocio con la convicción de generar un ingreso más al hogar.  Logro establecerlo con sus propios esfuerzos. Lleva trabajando en su negocio 18 años el cual lo tiene en un puesto del mercado de la ciudad. Manifiesta  que le ha ido muy bien porque las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas son rentables y de las cuales ha seguido reinvirtiendo para mantenerlo estable.
Lleva dos préstamos con ODEF y actualmente solicito otro de 10,000 lempiras para más mercadería como zapatos (tenis) tanto como caballeros y niños. Con esta inversión lograra aumentar su inventario y obteniendo los ingresos rentables para la sostenibilidad de su familia.
Su meta es seguir trabajando en su negocio para en el futuro hacerlo mas grande.
texts.en:
Alis Cecilia, age 43, is married and has six children, ages 19, 16, 14, 9, and 10.  She lives in a neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

Alis has a business selling shoes; to be specific, she sells tennis shoes for men and children.  She started this business with the expectation of generating more income for the household.  She managed to establish her business through her own efforts.

She has been working in her business for 18 years.  She has a stand at the city market.  She says that it has gone very well for her because her sales are very profitable.  With her income she has continued to reinvest in order to keep her business stable. 

She has had two loans with ODEF.  She is currently requesting another for 10,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like tennis shoes for men and children.  With this investment she will manage to increase her inventory.  She will then get profitable income to sustain her family.

Her goal is to continue working in her business in order to make it larger in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: René

texts.es:
La señora René se dedica a la reparación y elaboración de ropa, tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose a este oficio. Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprarse una maquina de cocer para trabajos más difíciles de elaborar  como son vestidos para eventos sociales, como son vestidos de novia, quince años y de fiesta, también desea mejorar el local, ya que lo tiene en su propia casa. 
Doña René es madre soltera, sus hijos ya son personas mayores y tiene su propia familia, pero le ayudan con los gastos familiares. 
Desea mejorar su negocio y así obtener sus propias ganancias, la señora René es una persona independiente y no quiere ser una carga para sus hijos es por eso que desea invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
René makes her living mending and making clothes, she has already spent more than two years working as a seamstress. She is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine for designs which are more complicated to make such as clothes for social events, for weddings, for quinceañeras (galas for girls' 15th birthdays), and for parties. She also wishes to improve the premises, as they are located in her own home. 

René is a single mother, her children are already grown up and have their own family, yet they help her with household expenses. 

She wishes to improve her business and thereby earn her own profits, René is an independent person and she doesn't want to be a burden to her children, which is why she is keen to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and repair the premises.

loans.name: La Guadalupe Cruz De Corazon Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre la Guadalupe cruz de corazón ya que las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre, porque son devotos de la virgen de Guadalupe y por que así se llama la comunidad donde viven, esta historia es acerca de la señora Cecilia, ya que es la representante de este grupo, ella tiene 33 años de edad y es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos, Maribel, Omar y Francisco quienes cursan tercer año de secundaria, uno más quinto año de primaria y el menor tercer año preescolar, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva más de 10 años.

Ella dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio porque quería buscar la manera de apoyar a sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad de vida, aparte de que esta actividad le permite estar al pendiente de ellos y no descuidarlos, el crédito que recibió lo va invertir en la compra de mercancía como son: refrescos, leche, aceite, frijol, arroz, frijol, galletas, pastas para sopa, huevos, jabón, aguas y jugos, para tener un poco mas surtido su negocio

La meta que se ha puesto doña Cecilia es la de ofrecerles una excelente calidad de vida a sus hijos ya que también, quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, tanto que está pensando en ampliar su local para poner una abarrotería y así tener mucho más surtido y con más variedad de productos, para mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Doña Ceci (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad) le da las gracias a nombre de ella y de su familia a Fundación realidad y kiva  por que con esa ayuda que le están brindando podrá mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia, puesto que ahora gozaran de una solvencia económica más estable.

Las integrantes del grupo Guadalupe cruz de corazón y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Anita-venta de ropa, Cecilia-abarrotes, Daniela-venta de zapatos y johana-venta de comida
texts.en:
This group carries the name Guadalupe Cruz de Corazón since the people who are members decided to give it this name because they are devoted to the virgin Guadalupe and they have named the community where they live accordingly. This story is about Cecilia since she is the representative of the group. She is 33 years old and is a single mother to three children: Maribel, Omar and Francisco who is in his third year of secondary school,one is in Fifth Grade and the youngest is in the third year of preschool. She has owned a shop for groceries for more than ten years.

She says that she decided to start this business because she wanted to find a way to support her children and give them a better quality of life. Additionally, this activity allows her to be aware of them and not neglect them. They loan that she received will be invested in the purchase of merchandise such as drinks, milk, oil, beans, rice, cookies, soup pasta, eggs, soap, water and juices so her store is a little more stocked.

Cecilia's goal is to offer her children an excellent quality of life and also to grow her business a lot more so much so she is thinking about expanding her shop to make a grocery store and have a lot more stock and more variety of products to improve and increase her earnings.

Ceci, as she is better known in her community, thanks,  in her name and that of her family, Fundacion and Kiva because with this help that you are providing she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family since now they enjoy more stable economic situation.

The members of the Guadalupe Cruz de Corazon group and the activities that they perform are the following: Anita - selling clothing, Cecilia-groceries, Daniela - selling shoes and Johana - selling food.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as drinks, milk, oil, beans, rice, cookies, pasta for soup, eggs, soap, water and juice.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
As a child, Chris witnessed his father teach himself to DJ. As he grew, Chris learned to DJ by helping his father during events. Since then, Chris, 27, has learned new tricks, but he credits most of what he knows to his father’s guidance. 

For the past 10 years, he’s worked as a DJ, but as of March 2012, he completed his first year as an entrepreneur with his San Antonio business: I.C.A.D.J. Entertainment. At some point, Chris hopes to hire more DJs, but at the moment, he is focused on doing his own work. 

Aside from being a DJ, Chris works for Time Warner, sells travel packages for another company and, in his free time, assists other DJs. He said not being in only one field of work helps him be a better person. He decided to become an entrepreneur after he realized that he could grow monetarily while using his communication strengths to his advantage.

“The unique thing about me, I don’t require multiple DJs.” he said. With him as the only DJ, Chris said, there is more room for personal time with the client or coordinator. “It allows me to give better value in price,” Chris said, adding, “I deliver value on all events.” 

During events, Chris includes a variety of lights to give a club vibe. Chris said it doesn’t matter how many lights a DJ has, what’s important is what he does with them. 

Prior to contacting ACCION Texas Inc., Chris discussed the possibility of applying for a loan at Security Service Federal Credit Union. Afterwards, a SSFCU employee approached him and introduced ACCION to Chris.
 
Chris will use the loan to upgrade his equipment and repair his vehicle that transports him to events. His list includes a pair of 18” Harbinger speakers for better sound, and lights, some of which are still working but are old, he said. He is also interested in purchasing laser lights. The rest of the loan will contribute to online marketing with the North Chamber of Commerce. 

Chris said he is excited and looks forward to making good use of the loan and turning it into something better. “My goal is to improve annually,” he said. “This is a big step for me.”

loans.use: To update equipment and repair his vehicle.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Fanny works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Fanny is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell to customers.

Fanny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: 16 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 16 de noviembre tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Cándida quien vende calzado, comida, fresco y helado desde hace 7 años  e invertirá en calzado y comida para aumentar su negocio. 
Ella es casada y tiene dos niños de 7 y 4 años respectivamente.
Las otras integrantes son Maritza quien tiene un taller donde realiza cosa de horno artesanal desde hace 10 años y Miguel es comerciante de aluminio y vidrio.
texts.en:
The group 16 de noviembre is composed of 3 hardworking entrepreneurs, one of whom is Cándida, who sells shoes, food, soft drinks and ice cream, with seven years of experience.  She will invest in shoes and food to grow her business.  She is married and has two children, aged 7 and 4.
The other members are Maritza, who runs a workshop producing homemade baked items, having run this business for 10 years; and Miguel who sells aluminum and glass.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise and basic grains

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en: Japheth is a single man. He describes himself to be courageous and open-minded. He operates a bicycle and retail store selling items such as sugar, salt, flour, sodas etc and where he provides motorcycle transportation. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located within a busy and profitable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of fuel. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy home products for sale. His business goal is to own a cab within 5 years in order to enhance the mode of transportation he offers.

loans.use: to buy home products for sale

loans.name: Harselina

texts.en:
Harselina is 51 years old. She is married to Catalino, a farmer in the village of Maligaya. 

Harselina has engaged in her sari-sari (variety) store business for three years. She earns about PHP 300 a day and she uses it to provide their daily needs and pay for their monthly electric bill. 

As of now, Harselina wants to borrow PHP 5,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, bakery bread, oil, noodles and so on. She hopes to grow her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, bakery bread, oil, noodles and so on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, breads and rice for her store.

loans.name: Wendkouni De Kalgonde Group

texts.fr:
Mme KOURA est la représentante du groupe WEND KOUNI DE KALGONDE. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq(05) enfants. Le plus âgé a 27 ans et le moins âgé a 21ans. Parmi ses enfants un (01) va à l’école. Elle a deux (02) personnes en charge.

	Mme est restauratrice depuis 15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le quartier. Ses clients sont des hommes et des femmes.

	Mme veut s’acheter cinq (05) sacs de riz, deux (02) bidons d’huile et deux (02) cartons de spaghetti.

	Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne participer à la scolarisation des enfants et agrandir son restaurant.
texts.en:
Ms. KOURA is the representative of the group WEND KOUNI DE KALGONDE. She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 27 years old, and the youngest is 21 Among the children, one goes to school. She has two persons to support. 

Ms. KOURA has been a restauranteur for fifteen years. She gets her supplies in her district. Her customer base is composed of men and women. 

Ms. KOURA is buying 5 sacks of rice, 2 containers of oil, and 2 boxes of spaghetti. She uses her profits for bolstering her business. Her ambition is to help with her children's education costs and to expand her restaurant.
